It was a late night and the Fartmeisters had just finished moving in. Julie was on the phone talking to her husband.

"Yes we're all settled in" Julie said "They start at school tomorrow. I miss you too...bye honey"

Ruby and Elena walked in just as she hung up the phone.

"How's daddy?" Ruby asked

"Busy as usual" Julie said standing up off the couch "So what do you want for dinner?"

"Can we go out to eat?" Elena asked "I heard there's a great Mexican restaurant in town"

“I don’t know if Mexican is such a good idea” Julie said “We’ll be pooting and tooting all night if we eat there”

“So what?” Elena said "We're always gassy anyway. What's the big deal"

“We just moved here” Julie said “I don’t think I’d be a good idea to knock down half the neighborhood on our first day in town”

"I vote for pizza" Ruby said

After about half an hour, a piping hot pepperoni and tomato pizza was delivered. The family talked as they ate.

"I'm looking forward to school tomorrow" Elena said

"Why?" Ruby asked "At the other schools all your classmates did was tease you"

"But now I can start over at a new school" Elena said "And maybe I can make some real friends her"

Julie took a bite of pizza "I want us all to try and exercise a bit more control here" she said "This is a perfect place to restart our lives, this is a perfect house for us, and I'd hate to have to leave town again"

THBBBBPPT

Julie tooted her booty trumpet, blowing the couch back a few feet.

"Pardon me" she said

They moved the couch back and finished the pizza. It was late, so after dinner the girls went to bed. The next chapter starts on the next day, who will we follow?

Julie shouted in frustration.
11232.title: Julie needs to pee

choices: A gassy fight begins between them!
The Blaster Bomber makes her escape.
11233.content:
Julie waited for quite some time and almost felt like calling it a night when she spotted someone headed around the back corner of the bank.

"Here we go." Julie was pretty excited that something was actually happening on her first day on the job. She grabbed a flashlight, got out of the car, and went around the same corner.

"Hold it right there!" she ordered, shining her flashlight at the suspect. It was a woman with somewhat long brown hair. She was a little shorter than Julie, but more hefty. She wore a dark-grey sweatshirt, black sweatpants that covered her wide posterior, and a ski mask. Julie found it rather stereotypical, but she knew she had no room to talk since ate a bunch of donuts.

"Alright, hands in the air where I can see 'em!" Julie ordered, which the woman obeyed. "Now what are you doing here?!"

"If you're a cop, then you should know." she said.

"Are you the...Blaster Bomber?"

"Yep."

"But you look a bit...different than what you were described. I thought you wore a bodysuit."

"Details get hazy when you barely have time to know whats going on. And I changed my outfit because of that!"

"Well whatever, now turn around!" This time the Blaster Bomber didn't move. "I repeat; turn around!"

The Blaster Bomber still didn't turn around, but she DID do something; something shocking.

FFFFFFVVVVVVVVVVVWWWWWWWWWWWVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTTTT!!

She ripped a huge, long, raspberry-like fart. While it wasn't incredibly forceful, it was still a huge blast that wilted all of the flowers in a wide area behind her behind, as well as blowing back Julie's hair.

Julie was in too much shock to say anything.

"Ahhhhh! It always ends that way." the Blaster Bomber sighed, lifted her mask above her forehead, and turned around, but she was also shocked that Julie was still standing.

"So THATS what your face looks like." Julie said. The Blaster Bomber's lips were plump and her cheeks were slightly chubby.

"How are you still awake? My gas has knocked out every person and cop in my vicinity!"

"Because you aren't the only plump woman around here with super-farts." Julie said proudly.

PPPPPWWWWWWWWWWWWRRRRRRRRRRVVVVVVVVVHHHH!

She lifted her leg and ripped a loud fart that caused the bank to sway a little in her breeze.

"Careful with that blast. You just might be helping me break in." the Blaster Bomber said, rather impressed.

"I figured thats how you break in without explosives. No wonder you came around the back."

"Oh its explosive alright!" the Blaster Bomber said enthusiastically with a big grin. "I blast a hole in the wall outside where the vault is, grab what I can, and go. Sometimes I'll just walk right in, knock out everyone in the bank in an instant with one blast before they know what hit them, grab what I can, and go. And if I am feeling really greedy and after some beans, chili, or Mexican food, I'll then go right up to the vault and unleash an SBD so noxious that it'll melt that massive soundproof metal door!"

"Wow, I'll admit thats very impressive and innovative, but its not exactly smart of you to tell me your techniques."

"Why? You're the only one who can withstand my blasts! Send the entire police force after me; I'll blow 'em all away! Their protective gear is no match for my butt, I'll explode their cars before they can even get away, and any gas masks or weapons they bring I'll melt! And I don't even need a fart-starter to do that!" the Blaster Bomber bragged, resting her hands on her stomach.

"I see your point, and you're right. I will tell you its a little sad; we moved here not too long ago, and I think you and I could've been good friends if you weren't a criminal."

"Criminals get caught. And I ain't going to become one anytime soon!"

"We'll see! I was the best cop where I used to live, and its for similar reasons as you. I could bring down any criminals with my gas in an instant without them even knowing, and at that point its easy to cuff and arrest them! It meant I always had to work alone, but it was worth it to make things a little safer each time."

"Thats not going to work with ME. You'll have to try something more traditional, and I explained why that won't work."

"So we both got our work cut out for us. Now before things get bad, I wanna know why you became a criminal. I mean, we're alike in a lot of ways."

"Its not obvious to you? I'm a fat gassy woman! Society don't want people like me! No man is going to find me attractive, and thats assuming someone would even want to be around me! Any job I get eventually...blows over, and stuff like that spreads almost as fast as my farts do! I didn't see any other options."

"I get how it is to be a social outcast, but that doesn't mean I turned to crime! You've gotta keep on searching and being a good person, and you'll come across the right path. My family had to move countless times and the way we were treated made things rough. It went on for years, but we kept on and eventually made it."

There was a moment of silence.

"Whoa...and here I thought things would never change for me...I bet if I met you before, it would be different, but I've gone too far to turn back."

"No you haven't! You can turn yourself in, and eventually...you can start a new life."

"You think it'll be that easy? If I couldn't get anywhere before, you think a criminal record will do me any favors?!"

"Then I'll have to take you by force."
11233.title: The Blaster Bomber strikes!

choices: Julie goes after the Blaster Bomber.
112332.content:
"Not tonight you won't!" the Blaster Bomber said to Julie.

PPPPPPPPPPPLLLLLLLLLLLLLBBBBBBBBBBBBLLLLLLLLTTTTTTTTTTTT!!

The Blaster Bomber blasted a loud fart that sounded similar to a huge balloon deflating. This blast created a huge puffy smokescreen of green gas. While Julie was fume-immune, the thick stenchful smog made her visibility almost zero. The cloud eventually spread out and faded, but the Blaster Bomber was nowhere to be seen.
112332.title: The Blaster Bomber makes her escape.

1123322.content:
Julie decided to head back to the station and report her findings on the Blaster Bomber.

"Hmm, if it weren't for the recommendations from your past work in the police force, I would believe this is some sort of joke, but what you have reported back with all adds together..." the police commissioner said.

"Well since the Blaster Bomber and I are the same in our...abilities, then I'm the only one who can bring her in."

"Yes, that looks to be the case. We will keep an eye out for her, and then immediately contact you when she is spotted."

"That works perfectly!"
1123322.title: Julie reports her encounter.

11233222.content:
A few days later, Ruby and Elena turn on the TV to a breaking news report.

"The mysterious burglar known as 'The Blaster Bomber' has been confronted and identified for the very first time. She is a heavy-set woman with brown hair. Even though she carries no weapons or tools of any kind, it is important that anyone who spots her contacts the police immediately and does not approach her. It turns out she possesses superhuman flatulence, which she uses to break into banks, subdue officers and witnesses, and evade capture. We all thank Officer Julie Fartmeister, who also has the condition, for this wealth of information."

The two sisters were stunned by this report.

"What in the HE-"

"HEY mom! Whats this whole Blaster Bomber story?!" Elena exclaimed, cutting off her older sister when she heard Julie coming down the stairs.

"Oh that, so they already got it to the news, huh? Well, she has very powerful gas, just like us Fartmeisters." Julie began.

"And Corey. And Ryan." Elena added.

"Right, well, she uses her gas to steal from banks and beat the police. I was the first one to actually meet her because-"

"Because Fartmeisters are resistant to super-farts!" Elena exclaimed.

"Elena, stop interrupting." Ruby whispered to her.

"I stopped her from breaking into a bank, but she got away." Julie said.

"How?"

"Basically a fart version of a smoke bomb." Julie said with a chuckle, which made Ruby grin and Elena giggle.

"So how are you going to catch her? I mean, shes probably resistant to YOUR gas too, right?"

"That's right, Ruby. I don't know how exactly, but we've at least worked out a plan. The police are on the lookout for her and I'll get a call as soon as shes seen, so I'll get another chance to take her in."

"Well good luck, mom." Ruby said.

"Yeah, I know you'll catch her, mom!" Elena said.

"Thank you, girls." Julie said with a smile and hugged her daughters.
11233222.title: About a week later...

112332222.content:
The next morning, Ruby and Elena were starting their walk to school.

"Sis, I've been thinking about this Blaster Bomber thing and I'm kinda worried." Elena said.

"About what? Mom will be perfectly fine, and there is no way some Blaster Bomber is going to be able to break into a Fartmeister-proof house." Ruby replied.

"No, its not that. It actually has nothing to do with the Blaster Bomber. It has to do with US."

"Like if we run into her or something? We'll just call mom right quick, and I bet the two of us can keep her distracted long enough for her to get there. Elena, I figured a gas battle would be something you'd be EXCITED for, not WORRIED-"

"No, its not that either! And I WOULD be excited for that! Sis, it has to do with other people! Other kids at our school! Judging us! Even worse than before! Like we're some sort of bullies who use our gas to get whatever we want or something like that!"

"...Wow, Elena, I never actually considered that...I guess we'll have to prepare for it..." Ruby said with a frustrated sigh.
112332222.title: The next day...

1123322221.content: Should the story continue from that morning?
1123322221.title: Unfortunately, Elena was right...

choices: Elena wants to go in, Ruby won't let her. Gas Battle!
Elena goes it, Ruby gets locked out (no cell service), Elena vs Blaster Bomber.
11233222211.content:
As luck would have it, not only did what Elena fear come to pass. But as luck would also have it, school was let out before the morning was over, and the shortest way home was suffering a burst pipe; so they had to go the long way.

Elena was letting out loud and short burst of gas with each step, a look of tranquil fury etched onto her face.

It wasn't because of the jeering, insults, and looks of both apprehension and fear. It wasn't even because of the jokes, in fact, she actually contributed to them so often that everyone just stopped.

Well, almost everyone.

No, it was because of the bullies, not the non-gassy ones, but the GASSY ones. They not only didn't care about the fear and apprehension, but RELISHED IN IT, joked about it - possibly more than Elena - and even got farts in on Elena.

A LOT of farts.

From Tally and her gang collectively sitting on her face and farting on it.

Ellen and his gang wrestling her to the ground and taking turns farting on her face.

Scarlet taking pot farts at her face all day before knocking her out with an SBD.

And Tammy, the biggest and most feared bully in school even before the Blaster Bomber came around, torturing her in front of all the aforementioned, and literally bathing Elena in her gas.

Ruby's day, however short, was FAR better by comparison. Sure she got looks from people, but there were actually MORE farters in her school than Elena's, so she didn't get as much annoyance as her younger sister.

The girls were so focused on their days, and taking the turns they memorized from Google Maps, that they failed to see that they had walked near an abandoned warehouse near a sewage plant in an abandoned district.

There were no cars.

The area had long since been abandoned years ago due to a reported "unfixable sewage leak". And there were no witnesses.

As far as anyone knew, the reason for the abandonment of the district was warranted by the smell of sewage that permeated the area, and that the girls had to stomach during their pass through it.

Granted, it wasn't something a Fartmeister had to worry about.

But it was still annoying, since it could mask their farts.

Though honestly that was more of a pet peeve for Elena, rather than Ruby or Julie, who hated one of their previous homes due to how close it was to a sewage treatment plant.

But a pass underneath an opened window allowed a certain smell to reach the two girls noses before it was snuffed out by the sewage reek.

A fart eerily similar to that of a Fartmeisters.

Stopping in her tracks, Elena looked to the warehouse and gained a wickedly mischievous smile on her face.

Ruby, who had stopped just ahead of Elena, looked to her younger and said, "Elena, what are you thinking?"
11233222211.title: Yes.

11233222212.content:
At lunch, Ruby discretely joined Elena at the far table with Ryan and Jeremy. Kyle and Corey were also there this time.

"Hey sis, hows your day going?" Elena solemnly asked.

"Glares, gossip, and avoidance. You?" Ruby asked in the same tone.

"Same thing..."

Spirits weren't better for the rest of the table, either. Kyle and Jeremy were also upset over this mistreatment, Corey looked very annoyed, and even Ryan was almost shaking with anger.

"I hope nobody...bullied you girls...did they?" Jeremy asked.

"Thankfully, no." Ruby said.

"Yeah, THAT at least didn't happen..." Elena said.

"That's...at least good..." Jeremy said, trying to stay positive, especially since Ryan wasn't in the mood to lighten the mood.

"Yeah, if I ever found out someone was bullying my little sister, I would make them regret it, no matter who it was or where we were." Ruby said in a serious tone. Elena grinned a little, imagining Ruby blasting some punk with a huge fart.

"I'm real sorry. My parents and older sister feel really bad for you guys too. We all had a bad feeling that this would happen to you guys." Kyle said.

"People are just so judgmental. I'M used to this. If its not because of my geekiness, then its because of my gassiness that I'm targeted. I can handle it; its little more than an annoyance. But to see it happen to YOU TWO just really gets at me!" Corey said.

"This is all that Blaster Bombers fault!" Ryan exclaimed, slamming his fists on the table. "SHES why everyone is being such insensitive jerks! If it wasn't for her, I bet we could get people to like us, but she made that impossible! Elena, Ruby, Corey, Julie, Guthrie, and I, and even HER, were all blessed with a powerful gift and she goes and takes advantage of it!" Feeling pumped, Ryan stood up. "Farts should be used for GOOD; not EVIL!!" he shouted.

This caused a lot of the other students to stare at him, after all, they still weren't aware he had that "gift". After a moment, Ryan cleared his throat and sat back down.

"I-I think we all need to just go and do something fun after school today. Its an extended weekend, whattya guys say?" Jeremy suggested.

Nobody responded.

The muscular boy just sighed and slammed his head on the table.
11233222212.title: No, skip ahead.

112332222122.content:
Ruby and Elena were on their walk back home from school; both of them feeling really crummy.

"At least it'll be good to be home and done with these jerks." Elena said.

"You said it." Ruby replied in agreement.

Unfortunately, the jerks weren't done with them.

Ruby felt something bounce off the back of her head and the sisters turned around. There were a trio of bullies staring down on them. They all had a build like Jeremy, but certainly not the kindness like him.

"Well look at this, its the infamous Fartmeisters! Off to use your gross disabilities to commit crimes since you'll never amount to anything other than sideshow attractions?!"

"I can't believe you freaks even show your faces in public! Do you honestly think anyone will talk to you?! God forbid if you think you can get some GUY to give EITHER of you any of his time; NOBODY finds what you do attractive!"

"Hell, how do you two even go through life knowing you'll always be social outcasts?!"

Ruby and Elena reached a breaking point. Which of the sisters fights back?
112332222122.title: After school...

1123322221222.content:
Ruby gritted her teeth. Normally she would give these bullies an earful about what jerks they were being and then MAYBE gassing them if they were particularly cruel, but she was in no mood for that today. The fact that they were also targeting Elena only made her angrier.

PPPPPPPPPRRRRRRRRRBBBBBBTTTTT!!

Ruby swiftly blasted a loud low-pitched fart at the bullies. It wasn't particularly notable as far as a Fartmeister was concerned, but it was strong enough to blow them backward and into the yard of the house across the street. It was unclear whether they were stunned (either in surprise or by the smell) or knocked out, but either way, they weren't getting up.

"Come on, Elena, lets go." Ruby said as they continued on. She could tell Elena was really affected by all of this since all she did was crack a smile, rather than flip out excitedly as she usually did when Ruby publicly passed gas.
1123322221222.title: Ruby

choices: They take up Jeremy on his suggestion.
11233222212221.content:
The girls reached home and Ruby unlocked the door. They found a note on the table from Julie that she would be working very late with helping the police coming up with a strategy against the Blaster Bomber.

"Great, TODAY of all days..." Ruby muttered.

"Is it just me or does our house feel...empty all of a sudden? Is this how staying here is ALWAYS going to feel like?" Elena said.

"...No, Elena. We aren't just going to lock ourselves up in here; that's just what those pricks WANT us to do. We need to raise our spirits, we need to go and do something FUN with our FRIENDS." Ruby said with confidence.

"Yeah, just like Jeremy said! So where should we go, sis?" Elena said, now on board.
11233222212221.title: The girls reach home.

choices: The girls get a call as well.
112332222122212.content:
"Well, I know we have been seeing him an awful lot lately, but what about Guthrie's place?"

"Oh! Yeah! If ANYONE knows about fun things to do its him!"

"...Besides, I wanna know how he is handling all this Blaster Bomber business." Ruby added.

They left a note that they would be hanging out with Guthrie, then got in Ruby's car and left. They soon arrived at Guthrie's manor and rang the doorbell.

After a moment, Guthrie answered. "Oh, Elena, Ruby, welcome." he said.

Ruby and Elena glanced at each other for a brief moment. This run-of-the-mill greeting wouldn't tip any normal person off, but for someone as eccentric as their cousin, this was NOT a good sign.

The girls sat down on one of the couches and Guthrie across from them.

"So, whats up?" he asked. Now they definitely knew something was wrong.

"Guthrie, are you...feeling okay?" Ruby asked.

"Of course, why wouldn't I be?"

Ruby wasn't quite sure how to word things without coming off as insensitive. "Because you aren't...you usually...I mean, I don't think-"

As usual, when her sister was beating around the bush, Elena would cut her off and put things bluntly. "You aren't making any jokes or gestures or being silly and stuff!"

"Hm?" Guthrie knew exactly what she meant, but didn't want to acknowledge that glaring problem.

"Is it...Is it because of the Blaster Bomber?" Ruby asked in a gentle tone.

Guthrie flinched at the mention of that name, nearly causing his glasses to fall off.

"Bingo." Elena quickly whispered to her sister.

"You...know about that?" Guthrie asked, leaning in.

"Well yeah, it was on the new-!" Ruby covered her younger sisters mouth. Now was NOT the time for being mouthy.

"Yes, we heard about it on the news. Our mom is working hard to figure out how to catch her." Ruby said.

"You guys are right, there IS something going on with me and its because of HER. I know I don't talk about this kind of stuff a lot, but its about my job. Listen, it wasn't easy climbing up the corporate ladder, even with someone of my intellect. No matter how high up you are in the business world, there is always someone who is above you. Thanks to that news story, they are starting to believe having someone like me so far up could hurt their business, even though they are a multi-million dollar corporation! I am at a severe risk of being demoted, or even worse, FIRED!"

"Did they...not know about your...you know?"

"Oh they knew all right! At first they were willing to look past it due to how successful I was at the job, and as I made good terms with everyone, they accepted it! That isn't to say I would smell-up the building, at least not all the time, but nobody ever had an issue with it...until now. Even though literally nothing has changed about me, all of a sudden its a huge deal!" In an almost unheard of moment for him, Guthrie was getting angry. "This...this whole thing is just NUTS! I'm not the kind of guy who lets success get to my head, but to have the rug pulled out from under me when I've done NOTHING to deserve it after coming so far is just...BULLSHIT!"

In frustration, Guthrie grabbed a priceless vase and threw it against the wall, shattering it to pieces. Elena and Ruby froze and didn't say a word; they had never seen their cousin get so worked up before in their lives.

After a moment of realization, Guthrie took a few deep breaths, adjusted his glasses, and faced his cousins. "Elena! Ruby! I'm SO SO SOOOOO sorry you two had to see that! I should NOT get you gals wrapped up in my drama. The past few days have just been too much for me and reliving the whole experience by telling you gals about it just set me off."

"F-few days?" Elena asked in a barely audible voice.

"Yeah, we heard about all this before it was broadcasted." Guthrie then bowed his head. "Again, I apologize for freaking out in front of you two. I hope you've been having a better time than I am."

Elena fidgeted in her seat while Ruby scratched her arm and looked away.

Ruby decided they might as well come clean. "Actually, we-"

Guthrie let out an annoyed sigh when his cell phone began to ring. "Hold that thought." he said with a raised pointer finger and left the room.
112332222122212.title: They visit their cousin.

choices: They make up an excuse and leave.
1123322221222121.content:
"Sis! There is no way we can tell Guthrie about what happened today!" Elena whispered.

"We NEED to, Elena. That's kind of why we came here!" Ruby whispered back.

"No, we came here to see how HE was handling this, and its NOT good! We're only making things worse!"

"I KNOW we're only making things worse, but he is gonna know sooner or later! Better it be now than if things get worse for ANY of us!"

"Well what if he is being fired right now?! We'll be rubbing salt in the wounds!"

"Then what do YOU think we should do?!"

"Tell him things are going alright!"

"We can't do that! Elena, you're a terrible liar, and he's gonna know we're covering for something anyway!"

"Then lets just leave! We can go and meet up with Jeremy and the others somewhere!"

"Elena, that would be incredibly rude!"

"Then lets just give some kind of excuse to leave when he gets back!"

"That, again, would be lying..."

"Yeah, but its more convincing and easier and we don't have to do it with a straight face since we can act like we're in a hurry."

"...I GUESS that's true, but..."

The sisters could hear footsteps approaching.

"Well, sis, what do we do?"
1123322221222121.title: The girls discuss the situation.

choices: He is understanding and tries to cheer them up.
11233222212221212.content:
"...We stay put and tell him the truth. As our cousin and close friend, he has every right to know."

Elena groaned, she knew her sister was right, but she was worried of how the already stressed out male Fartmeister would react.

"So, my good cousins, unpausing our conversation, wutcha wanted to say?" Guthrie said in a chipper tone, walking back into the room.

Elena and Ruby glanced at each other from their cousins sudden shift in attitude.

"Guthrie, you're...yourself again!" Ruby said in both shock and confusion.

"Yep, I'm right as rain! Those bigwigs got their acts together and realized what a silly mistake they would have made by laying off such an important company asset! Losing me would likely hurt them quite a bit more than me possibly stinking up their rep a little bit with some judgmental jerks who probably aren't worth the support anyway! Guess I'm not the only one with a working brain there after all!"

"That's great news, Guthrie!" Ruby said.

"Yeah, for sure!" Elena said.

"It certainly made my 'tude do a 180, I'll tell you that!" Guthrie exclaimed.

"Yeah, uh, since it came up, I always wanted to know...What exactly DO you do, Guthrie?" Elena asked. Ruby nodded once; she was always curious about this as well.

"Ahp ub ub!" Guthrie put his pointer fingers up, "That's enough about me for now, I wanna know whats going on with YOU GUYS." he said, dodging the question.

"But-!" Elena exclaimed.

"No buts! Especially not from a Fartmeister!"

Ruby rolled her eyes at that lame joke he would always make.

"But seriously, I wanna know what was up before? I told you MY story, so its only fair to return the favor, right?" Guthrie said, plopping down on the couch between them, leaning back, and resting his arms across the back of it as if to obnoxiously take up the most room possible.

ffffffwwwwwwwrrrrrrRRRRBBBBBBBBLLLLLLLBBBBBBBVVVVVVVVVBBBBBBBTTTTTTTTT!!!

Guthrie then elevated his butt off the couch and let out a high-pitched squeaky fart that went into a loud bubbly fart.

"Ahhh..." the young adult Fartmeister smiled and sighed. Elena giggled at his emission while Ruby smiled and shook her head, amused at what a stereotypical slob her cousin was suddenly acting like.

"So how about it?" he said.

"Well...we were saying that we..." Elena was even more hesitant to talk than before as she didn't want to swiftly ruin her cousins good mood so soon.

"Its perfectly fine if you two spill the beans. Trust me, its not like I need them anyway." Guthrie said in a relaxed tone and elevated his posterior again.

FFFFFFFFFVVVVVVVVVVVRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVBBBT!

The glasses-wearing guy let out a very long and very loud muffled fart that violently vibrated the couch. Elena and Ruby displayed the same amused reactions as before.

"Ahhh, I feel better now. How about you two? Do you two feel better now to tell your cousin whats up?" Guthrie asked in the same relaxed tone. He wasn't just passing gas for the fun of it, although he certainly was enjoying himself, but he was also trying to get his cousins to loosen up enough to come clean since he could definitely tell something was wrong with them.

"...Alright, well remember when you asked how things were going for us since the news? Well...not good. Not good AT ALL." Ruby explained.

Guthrie's look immediately changed to concern as he he quickly sat up straight and placed his hands in his lap.

"Yeah, at school today, just about everyone was either ignoring us, giving us dirty looks, or gossiping. It wasn't THAT bad, since we've certainly been through worse, but just happening HERE when we are finally starting to settle in, and, like you, for a really dumb and judgmental reason!" Elena added.

"And sadly, I think things are only going to get worse, because after school...this group of bullies came up to us and said some very terrible things. You know how I feel about bullying and I was even more upset than usual then, so I...put them in their place. Our mom was going to be working late and we needed to do something to cheer us up, so we came here."

How does Guthrie react?
11233222212221212.title: They tell Guthrie the truth.

choices: The trio does something fun together.
The Blaster Bomber is brought up again.
112332222122212122.content:
"My...my cousins are getting BULLIED?! Idiot judgmental jerks are messing with my cousins?!" Guthrie was getting angry again, but this time it was out of familial bond instead of a stressful time at work.

"Guthrie?" Ruby was really hoping this wouldn't get him worked up, but he had to know.

"I can handle this happening to ME; the business world can be a really cruel place, but you two are having the same problem?! What did these people say to you?! Ya know what? I don't even wanna know. WHO were these people that said this to you?!"

"Well its not like they introduced themselves to us..." Elena grumbled, regretting giving Guthrie this news.

"If these low-lives think they can get away with this, then they've made a HUUUUGE mistake! I'll make them regret the day they decided to-!"

"GUTHRIE Calm down!" Ruby shouted, which surprised both him and Elena. "We're really glad you care so much, but...there is nothing you can do to stop them."

"Sadly, Ruby's right. Its not like you can just follow us into school and beat up anyone who insults us." Elena added.

"Whoa, 'beat up'? That's putting it on a bit thick, Elena. I'm 24 and its a bunch of teenagers, its not like I'm some middle-aged guy going into a school to hurt some little kids. Besides, you known darn well I don't need to lay a finger on ANYONE to bring them down!" Guthrie said.

"What Elena means is you can't defend us from every person who picks on us, and honestly, you don't NEED to. Elena and I can take care of ourselves. Its tough for all of us, but we just have to face it." Ruby explained.

Guthrie took a deep breath, took off his glasses, rubbed his temples, put his glasses back on, and exhaled.

"You're absolutely right, Ruby. You guys don't need your ol' cousin to fight your battles for you, and I know you've got each others backs, or BUTTS rather. Its just really upsetting to me. I know full well how much your family has had to move around because of it all, and I know that it has been tough on all of you. After all of that time, it finally seemed like you guys found the perfect place, but then THIS happens and its back to square one! I don't want you guys to have to leave all of this behind. I just want things to go back to how they were before, and I wish that people were more understanding."

"So do we, Guthrie, so do we."

"Just know you guys are always welcome here, and I am always willing to lend a hand, ear, or rear to help!"

"Thanks, Guthrie, that's great to know." Elena said.
112332222122212122.title: He is angry.

choices: Guthrie makes a call to arrange it.
They decide to do something fun with their friends now.
1123322221222121222.content:
"Hopefully Julie catches that Blaster Bomber soon, then maybe things can get back to normal around here." Guthrie said.

"You know, Guthrie, what if YOU helped catch her?" Elena suggested.

"Hmm?"

"I mean you're old enough, you have the same immunity as mom does, and with your smarts, I'll bet you can come up with a great plan!"

"Elena DOES have some valid points, Guthrie." Ruby said.

"Well its certainly a thought! And I'm sure my company wouldn't object to it! Plus it would be a huge step into blowing off all of this drama!"

"And I'll bet mom can pull some strings to get you in on it easy!" Elena added.

"Well then it sounds like a done deal! Thanks for the job offering!"

"Wow, can you imagine mom and Guthrie taking down the Blaster Bomber in some kind of serious fart-off?" Ruby said.

"Oh I would give ANYTHING to see THAT!" Elena replied with a grin.
1123322221222121222.title: The Blaster Bomber is brought up again.

11233222212221212222.content:
"Well hey, enough business talk. We've been at that for WAY too long! I'd say we have some fun now! So whattya you two up for?" Guthrie asked.

"Well Jeremy made a suggestion that we all should do something together for our break, since we have Monday off." Ruby said.

"You mean like an extended weekend getaway? Well go on ahead and gather everyone over here and I can totally set us all up for anything!"

Elena and Ruby began contacting their friends, who soon started to arrive.

There was a knock on the door; Corey was the first to arrive.

"Corey! Welcome back to my humble home!" Guthrie greeted, answering the door.

"'Humble?'" Corey muttured to himself as he walked in.

"Hey Corey." Ruby greeted.

"Corey!" Elena greeted.

"Hey Ruby, hey Elena. Bet you're glad to be away from all of that annoyance at school." Corey said, taking a seat in an armchair.

"Yeah, we've actually been feeling a lot better since we've got here." Ruby said.

"Well Ruby, if there is anyone who can cheer people up, its Guthrie...Or Ryan, but he's still...worked up." Jeremy said as he and Ryan walked in and sat on one of the couches. Ryan still had a look of anger on his face and his fists were trembling.

"Poor Ryan! He's still been like that?"

"Yeah...I really don't know what to do. I've tried to cheer him up, but I just can't do it! Honestly, I never even HAD to do it before! This is RYAN here! He gets annoyed every now and then just like everyone else, but this is too weird!"

"Weirder than he already IS, yeah..." Elena said to herself. Ruby heard her and elbowed her hard in the side. "I mean, my cousin might be able to cheer him up, just like you said!" she said in a loud tone.

There was one more knock on the door; it was Kyle.

"Aha! KYLE! I haven't seen you as often as I'd like! With Jeremy being a regular visitor here, I would hope the same would go for the counterpart to my younger cousin!" Guthrie greeted.

"...You're nice and everything, Guthrie, but unlike Jeremy, I don't have a car...or a liscense." Kyle replied, not quite sure what Guthrie meant with the last part of his greeting, although he had a hunch.

"Thats why he needed ME!" an upbeat-sounding girls voice said. Guthrie opened the door wider to see Kyle's older sister Bianca, his longtime friend Scarlett, and Bianca's longtime friend Holly.

"OH! W-welcome everyone!" he said, very surprised to see all of these strangers at once. He allowed them all to step on through the front door.

Scarlett was about the same age as Kyle and Elena. She had long dark-brown hair and was wearing a blue dress.

Bianca, who spoke before, was about the same age as Ruby. She had blonde hair tieed into 2 braids and was wearing a red skirt and white shirt, which held her rather busty chest.

Holly was about the same age as Bianca. She had short brown hair and wore a dark-grey leather jacket, a black shirt, blue jeans, and a light-purple road bike helmet.

"I'm real sorry for bringing so many people here, Guthrie. I know its really rude and everything, but Bianca, Scarlett, and Holly have their reasons." Kyle said, feeling rather guilty.

"I had to drive him here since, as he said, he doesn't have a liscense." Bianca said, poking her little brother on the side of the head.

"I just HAPPENED to be over at the time and I REALLY wanted to meet Elena and Ruby again! Well, Elena again, I don't think I got to meet Ruby...Plus their cousin too!...I guess." Scarlett explained.

"And I just went because SHE went." Holly said, having a somewhat dull tone of voice and gesturing towards Bianca. "Oof!"

Bianca wrapped an arm around her friends shoulder and quickly pulled her in close.

"I wanted her to meet our possible future in-laws!" Bianca said excitedly, which made Kyle, Jeremy, and the Fartmeisters give her an odd look. "And if my little bro's old friend is coming along for the ride, then so is mine!"

"She like, kind of, forced me to come here. Really rude and insensitive of her, I know..."

"Oh, no no no no! Not at ALL, Holly! I'm happy to meet ALL of you! A friend of a friend of a friend is just shortened to 'friend' as far as Guthrie's concerned! Its not like this house is pressing for room, after all! And what kind of host would I be if I turned you all away?" Guthrie said.

"A sensible one."

"AHA! I like the mouth on THAT one!"

"Yeah, biker chick here has a thing to say about everything!" Bianca said, poking Holly in the side of the head.

"And I like your energy! We certainly need more of THAT since Ryan there isn't feeling like himself today."

"Ryan?" Scarlett said.

"Thats right! We should join the others in the living room! Come on! Come on!"

Guthrie took back his seat between his cousins, the three two-seated couches were used by Kyle and Scarlett, Bianca and Holly, and Jeremy and Ryan, while Corey was on one of the two armchairs.

"Hello Scarlett." Elena said in a low tone, eyeing her.

"Hello Elena!" Scarlett said, sticking out her tongue.

"Ruby, this is Kyle's friend Scarlett. Scarlett, this is my sister Ruby." Elena said, keeping the low tone.

"Hello Ruby!" Scarlett said, still sticking out her tongue at Elena.

"H-hi Scarlett." Ruby uttered, not sure what was going on with her and Elena.

Guthrie looked back and forth between the two of them a few times. "Elena, is there...a feud between you and that girl?"

"Its nothing really serious, Guthrie!" Kyle assured him.

"I farted on her twice." Scarlett said in a teasing tone.

"Pfft!" Holly tried to resist laughing at this.

"Yeah, like that, which made her mad!"

Elena stood up and stomped her foot. "That is NOT how it happened!"

"So BOTH of my cousins have rivals?" Guthrie said as Elena sat back down.

"Ha! Scarlett WISHES she could be my rival!"

"I don't need to be rivals with you, anyway, ELENA!...So, Ruby, whose your rival?" Scarlett asked.

"That would be ME." Corey said, raising his hand.
11233222212221212222.title: They decide to do something fun with their frie...

112332222122212122222.content:
"What are the two of you rivals in? STUDYING?" Holly remarked, noting Ruby's nerdy look. Elena and Guthrie snickered, as they have made the same joke.

"Nope, THIS."

PPPPVVVVVVVVVVVRRRRRBBBBBTTTTTT!!

With a slight smirk, Corey lifted up his right leg and let out a loud sharp fart.

"Oh. Wow. Nice one." Holly was rather surprised, but also kind of impressed.

"Eh, I've done better. A LOT better." Corey said with a shrug.

"...Alright then. So you hold yourself to some sort of standards or something?"

"No, it was just weak is all. It didn't even shake the armchair."

"...Excuse me?"

"You aren't likely to hear THOSE words from a Fartmeister!" Guthrie said with a grin.

"I...Huh?!"

"Bianca, does she really not know?" Kyle asked his sister.

"Of course she knows! Like, she SHOULD, at least! I've told HER what you've told ME! She probably doesn't know about Ruby's rival, but I KNOW she knows about Elena and her family! Right, Holly?" Bianca said defensively.

"Huh? What ABOUT her family?" Holly asked, sounding oblivious.

"Even if you didn't tell her, she HAS to have seen the news! That's kind of why we came here, right?" Scarlett said.

"I already told you that I came here because SHE came here. And I don't watch the news; its all overhyped scares meant to get the public into a frenzy."

"Soapboxing much?! And I KNOW I told you about the Blaster Bomber story!" Bianca exclaimed.

"Was that today?"

"YES it was today!"

"Yeah, you didn't say anything about that."

"Yes I did! YOU probably weren't paying any attention! Quit trying to make me look dumb in front of everyone!"

"Trust me, Bianca, you don't need my help in doing THAT..."

Bianca smacked her friends helmet off at that comment.

"You set yourself up for that, Bianca." Kyle told her.

"Yeah, you REALLY did." Scarlett said in agreement.

"So this helmet, do you wear it all the time or something?" Jeremy asked, handing Holly the item in question.

"Its like her fashion statement or something." Bianca said with her arms crossed.

"Also, I like to be able to just hop on my motorcycle whenever and as fast as possible." Holly added as she adjusted the helmet straps.

"Oh, you've got a motorcycle too?"

"Yeah, but I came here with Bianca, Kyle, and Scarlett since I had no clue where this place was."

"That's fine, I didn't take mine here, either. Ryan...wasn't feeling like riding it, so I just drove his car up here." Jeremy said, looking at his friend sadly.

"Ryan! Why so blue? Is it because of the Blaster Bomber story?" Guthrie asked him.

"That's right." he replied quietly.

"Have...have jerks been going after YOU, too?"

"They don't know about me. And even if they DID, that doesn't matter. Its Ruby and Elena. They don't deserve this. People just don't make sense; they are judgmental and don't show any sort of feelings for those who aren't exactly like them. And this Blaster Bomber person...don't get me started on HER."

"Ryan, I know EXACTLY how you are feeling. People don't even THINK when it comes to something they are supposed to hate. It doesn't even matter if literally nothing has changed for those who are associated with that hate, because all of a sudden, they are in the wrong for absolutely NO reason! However, moping isn't the answer. After all, there is a reason that they want you to do just THAT. You have to stick it out and go right through it! You don't have to like it; you don't have to tolerate it, but you can't avoid it. You will find someone who understands and sympathizes with you, and when you do, then who cares what everyone else thinks? And in terms of Elena and Ruby? Don't worry about it! They got each others backs...or backsides, and they can handle themselves!"

"Guthrie...you are absolutely right. I really needed to hear that." Ryan said with a smile, lifting his head up. He then looked at Jeremy. "And Jerms, I'm super-sorry for being such a stick in the mud; I'm really thankful for you trying to make me feel better no matter what."

"Hey, no worries, Ryan. I'm just glad to have you back." Jeremy said with a smile.

"Phew! Everyone is in a good mood and all the secrets are out!...AGAIN! So anyone have any ideas for some weekend fun?" Guthrie asked.
112332222122212122222.title: Explainations are in order.

1123322221222121222222.content:
"Hold on. Not ALL secrets are out. What is this thing everyone keeps hinting about, but never actually outright SAYING?" Holly asked.

"This." Ryan said with a smile, standing up and facing away from where Bianca and Holly were sitting.

Jeremy was worried. While he was glad his best friend was back to his old self, he didn't want him to just fire one by people he just met, as unlike Ruby and Elena, Jeremy had never met Bianca or Holly either. He also didn't want to potentially ruin things between Elena's boyfriends family and friends.

"Ryan! I don't think you-!"

"Now now, Jeremy, if we are to have regular guests here, and said guests are to one day be our dear friends, then they must accept our supernatural emissions." Guthrie said in a mock-fancy voice.

"And I already know what he's going to do...I just didn't know people outside Elena's family could do it." Bianca said, bracing herself.

"Yeah, go for it, Ryan." Elena said.

Holly was starting to figure it all out. "Is he about to...?"

PPPPPPPLLLLLLLBBBBBBBRRRRRRRRRVVVVVVVVVVVVVVRRRRRRRRVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTT!!!

The black-haired boy blasted a short bubbly fart that went into a very long and very loud sharp fart. Bianca wrinkled her nose and her braids fluttered in Ryan's breeze like ribbons, and Holly had a very surprised look on her face. Ryan's force was great enough that her helmet was lifted right off her head, and she barely managed to grab it by one of the straps.

Ryan turned around and flashed the girls a grin. He then became concerned, seeing the two girls reactions. Bianca was trying to fan away the faint green smog that Ryan's gas took the form of with both hands, but his smell wasn't so easy to get rid of as it lingered in the area around their heads. Holly, whose hair was frazzled as she didn't keep it as tidy as her friend did, had her helmet held up against her nose with her eyes widened in surprise and disgust.

"Ryan! That is SO gross!" Bianca said half-jokingly, turning her head to the side.

"Yeah." Holly said in agreement, but she wasn't as playful-sounding as the blonde.

Ryan bowed in regret and apology. "I made a BAD move this time! I just KNEW I would! But everyone seemed okay with it, and I...I was really hoping to make more friends! But I totes understand that not everyone is going to be okay with my powerful gas, and-and I can accept that! I just hope this doesn't make things awkward with Ruby, Elena, and the others!"

"I thought it was great and funny." Scarlett said with a shrug, and Jeremy nodded in agreement.

"I was joking when I said it was gross. Well, it still IS gross, but its not a huge deal for me. I want to get to know and like you guys, and as Guthrie said, I have to accept you guys for your...wind!" Bianca said with both her hands over her nose and mouth.

"How long does it...stick around?" Holly asked with her helmet still shielding her nose and mouth, seeming not to be as accepting as Bianca was.

"I usually have a...phase 2 of my blasts, but I...didn't want to blow you guys over..." Ryan said quietly, trying not to grin at his own description as he was worried about what Holly thought about this.

"Well that's what Holly has a helmet for." Scarlett joked, which made the girl in question giggle a little.

"Can't win 'em all, I guess..." Elena said with a sigh.

"Awwwwwhhhh!!" Ryan loudly groaned, flopping back on the couch next to Jeremy.
1123322221222121222222.title: MORE explainations are in order.

choices: Holly wants more of a demonstration.
Weekend plans are brought back up.
11233222212221212222222.content:
"H-Holly, you know there is a lot more to Ryan and the others than THAT. You...you realize that, right?" Jeremy said, hoping to convince her to give his friends and girlfriend a chance.

"Duh." Holly said, trying to fix her hair and putting her helmet back on as Ryan's gas was starting to spread out and fade.

"So do you think you could-?"

"Hang on, bodybuilder. I never said ANYTHING about not wanting anything to do with drummer or anyone else." Holly said, still trying to fix her hair.

"Uhh...'drummer'?" Ryan said, scratching his head.

"Aren't you? You LOOK like a drummer."

"Huh? No way! Not at all! I'd say I'm more of an athlete like Jerms here! I don't have his build, but I'm still good at sports and skateboarding and stuff like that!"

"...Skateboarder was going to be my second guess."

"So getting back to the thing you were saying before...?" Jeremy was curious as to whether Holly was fine with farts or not.

"...Right...THAT...I never said I wasn't going to like you all. I'm not like those judgmental jackasses you go to school with, and I'm not stupid, either."

"She just doesn't like to pay attention to things!" Bianca said, poking Holly on the side of the head.

"...Anyway, heck, I never even said I had any problems with your super-gas. I said it was gross, which it IS, but I don't care about that. Truth be told, I think its a ridiculously funny and sweet superpower."

"A superpower?!" Elena and Ryan exclaimed in unison.

"Not any of that 'save the world' lame stuff, but literally a supernatural power you've all got. Never have to wait in lines, sit wherever you want at the movies, knock out anyone you want with a single blast..."

"Now now, Holly, there is a line between proudly being a Fartmeister, and totally abusing your gassy gift! We would be no better than the Blaster Bomber if we did!" Guthrie told her, shaking his pointer finger.

"...The WHO?"

"HOLLY, you are so FRUSTRATING sometimes!" Bianca shouted, slapping her helmet off.

"Great power; great responsibility and all that, huh?" she said, picking up her helmet and putting it back on.

"Precisely!" Ryan said proudly, placing a fist on his chest.
11233222212221212222222.title: Holly isn't bothered by it.

112332222122212122222222.content:
"That's neat and everything, but what about those weekend plans?" Scarlett asked.

"Well lets hear some ideas. Anything you guys want, Guthrie here can make it happen!" Guthrie said.

"Because you're loaded?" Bianca asked.

"NO, because I'm a nice and fun-loving dude!"

"Don't mention his money!" Ryan whispered to the two girls.

"Welllll, what about a cruise?" Bianca suggested.

"That's a vacation plan, not a weekend plan, you dink. And Ryan JUST said to not mention the riches." Holly remarked.

Bianca went to slap Holly's helmet off her head, but she saw it coming this time and quickly buckled it.

"Holly may be right, but a cruise is certainly a fine summer idea. I'll have to do some looking into this. What else you guys have?" Guthrie said.
112332222122212122222222.title: Weekend plans are brought back up.

1123322221222121222222221.content:
"Might I suggest maybe something peaceful and out of the way...?" Guthrie said.

"What about...um..." Kyle was embarrassed to pitch his idea.

"Wutcha got for us, Kyle?"

"Its...nothing."

"Come on, Kyle! What is it? Tell us!" Elena encouraged.

"Um, a...weekend stay at a cabin in the mountains?" he suggested, blushing.

"...Kyle, that's really-" Holly then noticed Bianca giving her an absolutely menacing look. "If looks could kill..." she said to herself, tugging on the collar of her shirt.

"...I like it." Corey said.

"Yeah, that's actually a neat idea, Kyle!" Scarlett told him.

"Couldn't have come up with a better one myself!" Guthrie said.

"That's because you kind of led him into it." Ruby said.

"Why DID you lead him into it, exactly?" Elena asked.

"Because I OWN one, of course!"

"You BOUGHT a cabin out in nowhere? WHY?" Corey asked.

"Well technically, I bought some land there and hired some workers to construct it, but...Anyway, I did so in case I wanted to get away from everything and just relax out in nice, quiet, calm nature."

"Why would you EVER want to stay in some cabin when you live in this fancy-pants mansion?" Bianca asked.

"Well, Bianca, would YOU stay in your own HOUSE forever without going to any new places?"

"Do you take the dang HINT, Bianca?" Holly whispered to her through gritted teeth. "And she says I don't pay attention to things..." she whispered to Jeremy.

"How are 10 people going to fit in a cabin, Guthrie?" Jeremy asked.

"This isn't some dinky little cottage, Jeremy! Space isn't going to be an issue, trust me!" Guthrie assured him.

"So now the only thing to do is call our parents then." Scarlett said.

With that, everyone else left to different rooms to make phone calls, except Holly. The girl in question took out her phone and started using the internet.

"Um, aren't you going to call your parents, Holly?" Guthrie asked.

"Pssh! My parents don't give a care." she mumbled behind her phone.

Guthrie wasn't sure if what she said was true, or if she was just going through the "rebellious teenager" phase, but he wasn't going to press the issue.

After a few moments, everyone was back.

"So how did things go? Are we all in the clear?" Guthrie asked.

"Its all good with Kyle and I!" Bianca said.

"...My parents weren't super-confident about it, but I still got the okay." Scarlett said.

"My parents totally trust me!" Ryan said.

"I haven't given my dad any reason to think I'm not responsible, so he's fine with it." Jeremy said.

"All's right with me, too." Corey said.

"So NOBODYS parents had an issue with everyone going out to the middle of nowhere with some guy half of us JUST met?" Holly mumbled.

"'Some guy'?! I'm only 24! I'm not some creepy old fellow!" Guthrie said in protest.

"And just because YOU have parent issues, doesn't mean EVERYONE ELSE does!" Bianca added.

"Anyway, what about you two? Ruby? Elena?" Guthrie asked, looking at them.

"We...couldn't reach her. I guess shes still at work." Ruby said.

"We left a message, but...I don't know if that's...good enough?" Elena said.

"Understandable. Don't worry; we don't plan on leaving your behinds behind. I can leave a persuasive message; I'll explain to her exactly whats going on here. In the meantime, lets everyone pack up and meet back in an hour." Guthrie said.

"Its going to take you an hour to leave a message?" Holly said sarcastically.

"No, but it might take any of you an hour or so to pack up. Just giving everyone ample time here!"
1123322221222121222222221.title: A cabin in the mountains?

11233222212221212222222212.content:
After about an hour or so "passed", everyone was right back where they were.

"Great! Now that everyone is packed up, we have to figure out whats gonna get us there." Guthrie said.

"What about me and Ruby?" Elena asked.

"Like I said before; don't worry. I laid out everything in a message, and besides, Julie trusts me."

"So what did you mean by 'figuring out whats gonna get us there'? We need to take a train or something?" Scarlett asked.

"No, no, no, its not THAT far out! Its just there's 10 people that need to get there, and a train is the only thing that could do that in one vehicle. I could fit 4 of you in my car, but that only covers half of us."

"I could take the other 4! I don't mind!" Ryan volunteered.

"How about Bianca, Ruby, and I ride with skateboarder and his best friend?" Holly suggested half-heartedly.

"That would work." Jeremy said.

"So that leaves me, Elena, Scarlett, and Corey riding with Guthrie." Kyle said.

"Great! We've got it all planned out! Lets put our luggage in the cars that are gonna lug it and go!" Guthrie said, standing up.
11233222212221212222222212.title: Skip about an hour ahead.

112332222122212122222222122.content:
Ryan, Jeremy, Ruby, Bianca, and Holly were about 30 minutes into the drive there, following behind Guthrie's car in the forested area at either side of them. Jeremy was up front and Bianca and Holly were in the back with Ruby between them. The sole Fartmeister was looking a little uncomfortable.

"Are you feeling alright, Ruby?" Bianca asked.

"You getting carsick or something?" Holly asked.

"I'm...I'm just-" Ruby then remembered Ryan's warning about his car. "Actually, umm, Ryan, could you pull over please?"

"No prob! Can't hold it in, Ruby?" Ryan said, doing so.

"When you gotta go; you gotta go, I guess. At least its in the woods..." Holly muttered.

"That's not the reason why!" Ruby said quickly, stepping over Bianca, opening the door, and running across the road into the woods on the other side.

"Oh, I get it, she has to break wind, right?" Bianca guessed.

"And if she did it in here, she'd blow the back of the car out, right?" Holly added.

"Bingo." Ryan said.

"What about you and your demonstration to us? Do you pull over and just leave your car unattended like that? I'd never leave my bike out in the middle of nowhere like that where some punk could steal it."

"No, I just make sure I'm empty before I make any huge trips. I don't have it...reinforced like the Fartmeisters do with THEIR cars."
112332222122212122222222122.title: Follow Ryan's car.

choices: Jeremy calls for a tow truck.
1123322221222121222222221221.content:
"Did Ruby get lost? How long does it take-?"

BBBBBBBBBBWWWWWWWWWWWWOOOOOOOOOORRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPBBBBBBBBTTTTT!!!!

Bianca's question was answered by a massive tuba-like fart that echoed throughout the forest. A huge shockwave of stench blasted out through the large trees, instantly turning them into a collection of charred stumps. The wave struck Ryan's car, blasting the windows to dust, blowing out the tires, and nearly tipping it over as it absorbed the rest of the impact.

The 4 others were in shock.

"Ahhhhhh!!" a loud sigh of relief could be heard from Ruby, who was rather amused at her accidental feat. She was sure Elena and Guthrie would have quite the reaction if they were there.

She walked back to the car with a smile, not realizing what happened to it. Her mood quickly diminished as she got closer and noticed the damage.

"Oh my gosh! Are-are you guys alright?!" she exclaimed, placing a hand over her mouth.

"We're fine, Ruby, we're fine." Ryan said in a low tone.

"R-Ryan! I-I didn't mean-! You-you know it was just-! I hadn't realized-!" Ruby was at a loss for words, feeling extremely guilty.

"I know it was an accident, Ruby, don't worry." Ryan said in the same tone, placing his head on the steering wheel. He certainly wasn't mad at Ruby, but he was upset about the condition of his vehicle.

"This trip is certainly off to a great star-" Holly's snide mumbling was cut off by a charlie horse from Bianca.

"I guess we should call for a tow truck?" Jeremy suggested, taking out his cell phone.
1123322221222121222222221221.title: Ruby's fart damages the car.

11233222212221212222222212212.content:
"Hang on, Guthrie's coming back." Bianca said, pointing as his car came driving back around and pulled up behind them. He and Elena stepped out and walked over.

"Whats wrong guy-? OH!" Guthrie noticed the damage that was dealt.

"Hey, Ruby, whats up?" Elena asked, concerned.

"I...I did this. I stepped out over there to...you know, but it...hit Ryan's car and..." Ruby explained quietly.

Elena looked over and noticed the stumps, then looked at Ryan's car and noticed the damage. She gasped, impressed, but Ruby put a finger over her mouth; this was not a good time for ANY admiration.

"We-we can't...We can't..." Ryan didn't know how to word any of this properly without further upsetting Ruby.

"Ryan, don't you worry about a thing. I've got this." Guthrie said, which made Ryan look at him with a slightly confused look.

"What are you talking about, Guthrie?"

"I'm talking about your car, Ryan. I'll get it repaired, but not only that, I'll get it reinforced so its Fartmeister-proof just like mine is!"

"What?! Guthrie, are you for real?! How-how much would I owe ya? I mean, I wont be able to pay you back all at once, but every month I can send you a little-"

"You don't owe me a cent, Ryan! Its my treat! Consider it a gift for being such an amazing friend."

"What?! No way! You-you shouldn't-"

"Ah! I've already made up my mind!" Guthrie interrupted, holding up his pointer finger.

"You'd better listen to him, Ryan!" Elena said with a grin. She knew what was coming next if Ryan tried to object any further.

"Elena, I just can't let him-"

PPPPPWWWWRRRRVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTT!

Smiling, Guthrie cut Ryan off by ripping a loud fart.

"All I'm trying to say is that you don't-"

PPPPPPWWWWRRRRRRRVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTT!!!

Guthrie interrupted him again with a louder and longer fart. Elena giggled and Ruby grinned at this; they've seen this "technique" of his many times before.

"Guthrie, I just don't want-"

PPPPPWWWWWWWRRRRRRRRRRRVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTTT!!!!

"I'd feel guilty if you did-"

PPPPPPPPWWWWWWWWWWRRRRRRRRRRRRRRVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTTTTT!!!!!

"Please, Guthrie, at least let-"

PPPPPPPPPWWWWWWWRRRRRRRRRRVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTT!!!!!

Normally, Guthrie would increase the potency of these farts as well, but he didn't want to cause any further damage to Ryan's vehicle. Of course, as far as the others in Ryan's car were concerned, these WERE potent!

Jeremy turned his head away, Bianca covered her nose with both hands, and Holly put her helment over her face. Elena and Ruby, however, were having a giggle fit at all of this.

Ryan still tried to object to this. "Can I at least give you-"

PPPPPPPPWWWWWWWWWRRRRRRRRRRVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTTTTT!!!!!!

"Ryan, for the sake of our lives, SHUT. UP." Holly told him from behind her helmet.
11233222212221212222222212212.title: Guthrie comes back.

112332222122212122222222122122.content:
"Alright, Guthrie, you got me...I'll stop..." Ryan said with a sigh.

"Glad I could get you to come around, Ryan!" Guthrie said with a thumbs-up.

"Umm, Guthrie, why did you...?" Jeremy wasn't sure how to word his question about Guthrie's unique "interruptions".

"Because I love helping people, Jeremy. I'm not one of those selfish wealthy snobs; I don't need all I got, so I'm happy to lend a hand to those in need. And 'NEED' is the key word here! I won't go into details, because I trust you all won't try to use me for what you WANT, but just remember that Guthrie is NOT an ATM." Guthrie explained, wording the second part of his explanation with a very stern and matter-of-fact tone.

This unexpected shift in mood made Ryan and his passengers feel a little uncomfortable. Guthrie realized this and felt a tad uncomfortable himself.

"So sorry, guys! I didn't mean to make things awkward! I-I just thought I should establish that at this perfect opportunity, since I expect, or I hope, that this won't be the last time we all meet. Like I said, I don't believe you guys would try and take advantage of me, but still I-"

"Hey, no sweat, Guthrie! You're addressing the elephant before it gets in the room! We know its nothing personal!" Bianca said cheerfully to him.

"Interesting twist on the idiom, Bianca." Holly commented.

"Phew! Well glad you guys are so understanding!" Guthrie said, wiping his brow.

"Well back to before, we still have another problem. How are we supposed to get to the cabin without a working vehicle?" Ryan asked.

"Guthrie could always drop us off there while you guys wait here, drive back, and pick you guys up!" Elena joked.

"Now THERES an idea!" Guthrie joked as well. "No, but seriously, I'll call for a tow truck, ask him to make a little stop by my place, and you guys can hop in one of the vehicles still there!"

"So we all are supposed to cram ourselves in a tow truck until he gets there?" Holly asked half-sarcastically.

"We don't have much of a choice." Jeremy told her.

"And its only ONE person too much. Tow trucks have backseats, right?" Bianca asked.

"Well, the driver is on his way, so we'll meet you guys back there!" Guthrie said.

"Wait, we aren't going straight to the cabin?" Elena asked.

"Sorry, but I want us to arrive as a group. All for one and one for all and such."

"What?! Thats SO dumb! It doesn't make a difference!"

"Elena, don't whine." Ruby told her.

"And the more time you spend whining, the more time it'll take for us to get there and back." Guthrie added.

"...I guess you're right..." Elena grumbled.

She and Guthrie got back in his car, turned around, and headed back. A few moments later, the tow truck pulled up and Jeremy, Ryan, Bianca, and Holly got out, as did the driver of the tow truck.

"Is this Ryan's vehicle? Guthrie sent me here to pick it up after dropping you guys off." the driver said.

"Yeah, thats us." Ryan said.

"Your truck has a backseat, right?" Bianca asked, a little worried.

"Of course. Its still gonna be a tight fit for you guys." the driver answered.

"We can handle it, its fine." Jeremy said.

"Alright, you guys get situated in while I hook the car up and we'll be on our way."

Ryan sat in the front seat, and Bianca sat in the back seat with Ruby and Holly at her sides. Jeremy managed to squeeze in the back, pretty much sitting on both the laps of Ruby and Bianca!

After a few more moments, the driver got back in and they were headed back.

Ruby was embarrassed by such an uncomfortable contact with Jeremy, and Jeremy was embarrassed by his head right between Ruby's and Bianca's chests. Also, his broad shoulders were up against Ruby's and Bianca's faces.

"So remind me why didn't we have the bodybuilder sit up front again?" Holly sarcastically asked in a strained voice, being pushed up against the door from Bianca trying to move over to make a space for Jeremy to sit.

"I just figured...since its Ryan's car...he should sit up front." Bianca uttered.

"And I didn't think it was going to be THAT tight a fit; sorry." Jeremy added.

Ruby had no answer, she was too embarrassed. Her stomach answered for her with a loud gurgle.

"Umm, Ruby?" Jeremy was worried she was going to blast again, and he was more worried about her feeling humiliated again rather than the vehicular damage.

"I'm-I'm fine, Jeremy." Ruby took a deep breath, trying to calm herself and not pay any mind to this awkward seating arrangement.

"We definitely don't need you destroying a SECOND-" Holly's murmuring was cut off by Bianca, who had enough leeway to give her a major charlie horse.

"Thats super-insensitive and NOT funny at ALL, Holly!" she said through gritted teeth. Luckily, the snide girl had been quiet enough for only Bianca to hear.

"Y-yeah, I suppose I deserved that." Holly admitted.
112332222122212122222222122122.title: Ryan gives in.

1123322221222121222222221221222.content:
Before they knew it, the tow truck stopped in front of Guthrie's manor. He, Elena, Corey, Kyle, and Scarlett were out waiting for them.

Jeremy quickly managed to squeeze out of the truck, and Ruby, Bianca, Holly, and Ryan joined him. They took their luggage out of the trunk of Ryan's car, all of which were luckily undamaged, and set them on the driveway. With a wave, the tow truck driver drove off.

"Bianca, your car is the only one big enough to hold us all." Holly said.

"Great, now get your stuff in there and lets GO." Elena said impatiently.

The group did so and got in the vehicle in question. Bianca was driving with Holly in the passenger seat. Ryan was sitting in the middle with Ruby and Jeremy at his sides.

Guthrie's group also got back in their car; he backed out of the driveway and they were on their way again with Bianca's car following them.

They reached the cabin without incident this time and parked their vehicles.
1123322221222121222222221221222.title: Ruby holds it in.

11233222212221212222222212212222.content:
Everyone walked on in and were amazed at the interior; never seeing anything like it in a cabin.

The first floor was very spacious with side-rooms that led to the kitchen, dining room, laundry room, and a large walk-in storage closet. At the corner of the main room were two sofas and an armchair, all of them black-green and looked very comfortable. Wooden side-tables were next to each seat, and all of it was facing a large wide-screen TV hooked up in a crevice on the wall. Also, a large sliding-glass door was on the opposite side of the room, leading out to a deck that provided a grand view of the mountains and trees.

A large ladder on either side of the room led up to the walkway that went around the perimeter of the room and served as the second floor. There were three doors on each side: 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom.

"Guthrie, this is incredible!" Ruby exclaimed.

"You really pulled out all the stops on this one!" Ryan said.

"Glad you guys like it!" Guthrie said.

"So how does it work with the rooms?" Scarlett asked.

"Ah, well, two rooms have two single-person beds in them; two rooms have a king-sized bed in them. There is one of each on either side of the second floor." Guthrie explained.

"Good thing I saw all this coming! I brought a few sleeping bags! And they aren't some rough old rags; they are very comfortable." Bianca said.

"Way to think ahead, Bianca." Jeremy said.

"Way to think AT ALL..." Holly said, getting her helmet immediately slapped off by Bianca.

"So about room arrangements..." Ruby began.

"Well the rooms should be large enough that a sleeping bag could easily fit in each one, including the king-sized bedrooms, but I already have one of the king-sized rooms claimed...That leaves 3 of you in each room, and two of you together in a king-sized bed..." Guthrie explained, trailing off at the end.

"Jerms, Ruby, and I could room together!" Ryan exclaimed.

"I'll room with Kyle and Elena." Scarlett said.

"That puts ME with Bianca and Corey." Holly said, really not sounding like she cared.

"And which group will take the king-sized bedroom?" Guthrie asked.

"Jerms and Ruby can!" Ryan exclaimed, volunteering them. "And don't worry, I'll make sure nothing goes on there!"

"RYAN!!" Jeremy and Ruby shouted at him, blushing.

"Well I guess that settles everything. So now that arrangements are out of the way, whattya say we work on the dreaded task of unpacking everything?" Guthrie said.

Due to the large size of the group, a lot of luggage was brought to the cabin, thus it took quite some time to get everything out and set up. In fact, it was reaching the wee hours of the night by the time they were all finished. Everyone decided to turn in so they would be rested up for tomorrow.
11233222212221212222222212212222.title: They go inside.

112332222122212122222222122122221.content:
With Elena, Kyle, and Scarlett.

"So which one of us wants to call the sleeping bag?" Scarlett asked.

"Who would even WANT that old thing?" Elena asked.

"Thats right, Elena has never tried my sister's sleeping bags." Kyle said.

"Good point, Kyle. Elena, YOU should be the one to sleep there." Scarlett said.

"It isn't some hot, scratchy, flat sleeping bag. Its real comfortable."

"Well if you guys say so." Elena got into the sleeping bag between the two beds and was surprised how cozy and comfortable it was. "Wow, you guys were RIGHT!"

"Would we ever steer you wrong, Elena?...I mean, would KYLE ever steer you wrong, Elena?" Scarlett said, snickering.
112332222122212122222222122122221.title: In the rooms...

1123322221222121222222221221222211.content:
In the room Ryan, Jeremy and Ruby were at, Ryan was already out like a light just right on top of the sleeping bag to the left of the bed, not even bothering to get inside.

"Ryan? Wouldn't it be better to be IN the sleeping bag?" Ruby asked.

"Forget it, Ruby. Ryan usually doesn't bother with the covers for any place he sleeps. Besides, once he is out, he's pretty much impossible to wake up." Jeremy explained. "Which is good, because you don't WANT to."

"What do you mean?"

"Ever heard of something called 'morning thunder'?"

"Yeah, my mom has that. Don't need an alarm clock when you have a daily earthquake to wake you up." Ruby said, grinning.

"Well so does Ryan. Luckily, its more like 'noonish thunder', so as long as you aren't planning on sleeping in, its pretty easy to get up and out of the blast zone before he goes off. There ARE a few times when he's beaten me to the punch, and its not a pleasant thing to wake up to." Jeremy explained, also grinning.

"Then we should get as much sleep as we can, huh?"

Jeremy crawled into one side of the bed, stepping over Ryan, and Ruby crawled into the other. Both of them faced away from each other and slept as close and comfortably to the edges as they could.

Both of them were pretty uncomfortable, and the bed was certainly not the reason. If Jeremy was feeling embarrassed, then Ruby was feeling absolutely rattled!

Jeremy fell asleep rather quickly, but Ruby was shaking in embarrassment, and so was her stomach. She knew if she let loose, it would blow Jeremy right off the bed and landing on Ryan, who, in turn, would he himself let loose in a double-whammy of gas. The effort to hold back her gas was actually greater than her flustered feelings, and the girl was finally able to fall asleep. Little did she know, dozing off would relax her body just enough to release a toxic SBD lasting throughout the night...
1123322221222121222222221221222211.title: With Jeremy, Ruby, and Ryan...

choices: Corey still "aimed" in the same direction; he wanted to prank Holly with farts.
11233222212221212222222212212222111.content:
In the room Bianca, Holly, and Corey were at, Holly has no qualms with taking the sleeping bag. She had slept in them before, and she wasn't gonna wait to offer Corey that opportunity. Bianca was too sleepy to call on Holly's selfishness, and faceplanted into her pillow and dozed off.

"You sleep with your helmet on?" Corey asked Holly.

"I'm used to it, and it stops me from having bed head." she explained.

Corey shrugged, got in bed, and went to sleep. Holly was just about fall asleep as well, but something snapped her out of her daze.

PFFFT!

A sleep-fart from Corey.

It was a small raspberry-sounding fart that was really weak, even by the standards of an ordinary person.

Holly didn't really pay any mind to it and drifted off, but she was woken up for the second time.

PPPRRRRRRBBBBBTTTTT!

Corey let out another fart, this one was louder, longer, and deeper, but still nothing notable.

"Ugh." Holly sighed in frustration. She had to end this before it began by waking Corey. She sat up and moved over to him to shake him awake. Big mistake!

Holly didn't realize Corey was facing away from her, so when she tried to shake him awake, she was right in the blast range.

PPPPPPFFFFFFFFVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTTTTTT!!!

Corey ripped a very loud and very strong fart that fluttered and blew back his covers (as well as Holly's hair) like sheets on a clothesline. The force of the fart knocked Holly down to the ground and flung her helmet off her head and knocking it against the wall behind her.

"Ugh! That is SO awful!" she exclaimed to herself, covering her nose and mouth with her hands; she was used to using her helmet as a more effective means of stench shielding. The loud noise of said headwear caused Bianca and Corey to wake up.

"Wuh...wuh is happening...? How is...? What is going...?" Bianca stammered drowsily, too tired to figure out what just happened.

Corey was much more alert and sat up straight. "What was that noise?" he asked.

Bianca rolled over and noticed Holly's helmet on the floor. "Holly...? Why did...? Why did you...? You tried to throw...helmet at me...? Why would you do that...?"

"Trust me, Bianca, if I wanted to throw my helmet at you, I would make sure not to miss." she replied as she got up, put the piece of headwear back on, buckled it, and went back to her bag. "Its HIS fault."

"ME?!" Corey exclaimed defensively.

"Yeah. You forgot to warn us that you pass wind in your sleep."

"I...I do? Really?"

"Yeah. I tried waking you up, but your blast blew my helmet clear off my head."

"Wow." Corey said, trying not to grin at this.

"There is no way you could NOT have known this. Don't mess with us like that."

"Holly, I swear, I had no idea I sleep-fart, let alone STRONGLY sleep-fart!"

"Fine, I don't really care if you knew or not, just sleep with your cannon facing away from me."

"'Cannon'?" Corey blushed a little at the unintentional compliment Holly made.

"Actually, DON'T." Bianca said. "Holly totally deserves getting gassed for how she has been acting toward you guys."

"Oh, looks like YOU'RE fully awake now..." Holly said to her. "And don't even TRY to put Corey in your punishment position. I'll take having my helmet SLAPPED off over BLASTED off any day..."

"You've still been kind of insensitive to the Fartmeisters, Corey, and Ryan."

"Not...really. If you think THAT stuff was insensitive, then you must think all of the things I've said about people makes me a total bit-"

"Thats different! These are people we literally JUST met and they want us to accept them. They invited us to their dang vacation home, so you could AT LEAST act thankful, Holly!"

"If its worth anything, I'M not bothered by any of what you say, Holly. Heck, I even take it as sort of a compliment." Corey told her.

"You...take my comments about your gas as a...GOOD thing?" Holly asked, surprised.

"Yeah! I take great pride in my gas! The length, the sound, the force, and the smell!" Corey boasted, sounding like an announcer and placing his fist on his chest.

"WOW." Holly said flatly, not sure how to feel about that fact.

"So you're REALLY comfortable with what you got, Corey?" Bianca asked.

"You bet. Thats why the whole Blaster Bomber controversy doesn't bother me that much...Well, it bothers me because of how it affects my friends, but I've become used to the heat against me for some time now..." Corey explained, sounding a little somber for reminding himself of how Elena, Ruby, and the others felt.

"When you got the power, you gotta show it off, I guess..." Holly said with a shrug.

"Would YOU ever want that...power, Holly?" Corey asked incredulously.

"No." she replied without hesitation. "We each have our own things to do. I've got motorcycles, music, and messing around with people. You've got smelling-up buildings, peeling wallpaper, melting steel, whipping up gusts, blasting holes in concrete, blowing people backwar-"

"C-come on, Holly!" Corey sputtered, blushing again.

"Just do me a favor and keep it pointed the other way."

"Alright, alright, I will."
11233222212221212222222212212222111.title: With Corey, Holly, and Bianca...

choices: There is still gas that needs to be passed.
112332222122212122222222122122221112.content:
Ryan yawned, stood up, straightened his hair a little, and placed his hands on his gurgling stomach. He assumed Jeremy and Ruby already evacuated the area, and he was too groggy to register the fact that Ruby had already accidentally stunk up the room.

Thinking everything (or rather, everyONE) was safe, Ryan walked forward, stuck his butt out a little, and let loose.

PPPPPPRRRRRVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTT!!!

The black-haired boy smiled as he cut a very long, very loud, raspberry-sounding fart. The green smog from his butt quickly filled the small room, and due to the sheer quantity, thickened the visible vapor until all visibility was replaced with a green void.

"AHHHHHHHHH! That felt SO good!" Ryan said with a loud sigh, impressed by the effect of his fart fog.

"R-Ryan?!" Ruby weakly exclaimed, coughing. Even though she had the typical supernatural-stink immunity, the room was so small and Ryan's gas was so big that even SHE was having trouble handling it!

"Oh shoot, Ruby?! You were still sleeping?! I'm so SO sorry! Umm...Jerms is up, right? PLEASE tell me that Jerms isn't in here!"

"He's...he's still in here, Ryan. Sorry."

"SHOOT! We've gotta get him to safety!" Ryan ran over to Jeremy and managed to hoist the muscular boy on his shoulders. He grabbed Ruby by the arm and went straight for the door, somehow suffering very little visibility reduction from his own gas.

"Ryan, wait! I don't think thats a good idea!" Ruby exclaimed, still sounding weak.

The boy didn't hear her and flung the door open. With that, like a bursting dam, his gas rushed through the opening and filled the cabin with not only his smell, but also Ruby's. At the very least, the wide area dispersed his gas enough to clear the fog enough for everyone to see again.

"Wow, Ryan. I must say that I am impressed! Didn't know you had morning thunder, or I guess in this case, morning FOG!" Guthrie complimented from the couch below.
