"Uhh, thanks, Guthrie! But I think we should evacuate! Jerms is out cold and Ruby isn't doing a hundred percent, either! I didn't realize my gas would be this bad today!" Ryan replied uneasily.

"Don't give yourself...TOO much credit, Ryan!...I'm also...part of the blame!" Corey said, struggling to support both an unconscious Bianca and an unconscious Holly.

"Whats going on out he-? Whoa!" Elena exclaimed, opening the door.

"Elena! Your door! Close it!" Ruby quickly ordered.

"Why?"

"The gas! Kyle and Scarlett! Hurry!"

"Oh they...they fainted already."

"What?! My gas can't be THAT lethal!" Ryan exclaimed.

"OUR gas." Corey added.

"No...that was ME. I-I was feeling a little backed-up when I woke up...and...I kinda forgot they were there...I didn't think it was going to be so bad...but a Fartmeister SBD in such a small room...You can't really walk away from that..." Elena admitted, blushing and grinning, feeling both ashamed and proud.

"Yeah, evacuation sounds good then." Guthrie quickly said.
112332222122212122222222122122221112.title: The next morning...

choices: The conscious group decides to do something to "pass" the time.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121.content:
Elena had Kyle on her shoulders, Ryan had Jeremy on his, Corey had Holly on his, Guthrie had Bianca on his, and Ruby had Scarlett on hers. They carried them out the sliding glass door, over to the woods, and placed them up against a large tree.

"I...I hope they'll be alright." Ruby said worriedly.

"Oh sure! The worst that could happen is they'll be out for a few hours!" Guthrie reassured her.

"But this was a mixture of gas. Me, Corey, AND Elena! Thats a triple-threat!" Ryan said.

"And...and ME." Ruby admitted.

"Hm?"

"I was just so nervous being with Jeremy like that! I could feel it slipping out and...it probably lasted all night! I feel so BAD for him!"

Elena tried her hardest to hold back her laughter at her sister's confession.

"A four-person mixture of super-gas, huh? Yep, there is no way they could even stand a chance." Corey said.

"What about YOU?" Ryan asked him.

"Oh, turns out I pas gas in my sleep! Holly informed me of it. Even with my back facing the other way, I guess it doesn't stop the smell from accumulating."

"Ouch. So they could be out for quite awhile. We'll bring them back in after the smelly smoke clears." Guthrie said.

Ruby groaned, feeling worse about it.

Ryan placed a hand on her shoulder. "Don't you worry, Ruby. That was a one-time mistake! Either you or Jerms can take the sleeping bag from now on. I'm comfortable enough with you guys that I don't care if we're in the same bed...Unless being with ANY guy makes you uneasy, and if thats the case then the new sleeping arrangement is decided!"

"...Yeah, I think it would be best if I took the sleeping bag. I don't want to take any chances of that happening again, Ryan." Ruby told him.

"Thats fine with me! And I know Jerms will be understanding of it too!"

"I'd say that is for the best, anyway. I mean, would Jeremy even be cool with you and Ruby being...?" Corey was trying to lead Ryan into what he was asking; he didn't want to ask outright.

"Whoa! Easy there, Corey! Jeremy knows me well enough that I would NEVER do ANYTHING to take Ruby from him! That would make me absolute TRASH if I even TRIED to!" Ryan replied, a bit offended.

"Yikes! I get it, Ryan, I get it! I stepped out of line there, sorry."

"No worries, Corey. I was a bit snappy there, but I just don't want you to get the wrong idea of me is all."

"Alright. Hey Ruby, so did you REALLY release an all-night SBD on your roommates?"

"...Yes..." she admitted shamefully.

"Thats...really awesome, Ruby! Thats gotta be, what, about 7 or 8 hours straight? Nice one!" Corey complimented his rival and friend, which made her feel better, at least a little.

"Yeah! Hey sis? You think you could blast a 7-hour fart on purpose?" Elena asked, half-joking and half-curious.

"I don't know, Elena!" Ruby exclaimed, starting to feel more annoyed than ashamed.

"Which do you think will happen first? Them waking up, or the cabin being open?" Corey asked.

"Hmm, thats kind of a tough call. I'd weigh in on the cabin clearing up, but I don't know, thats a toxic quadruple cocktail of superpowered flatulence brewing in there, so it could actually take a long time to decontaminate!" Guthrie answered, trying to make things sound humorous.

"The only gas thats missing is YOURS." Ryan said to the host.

"Thats because Guthrie doesn't fart all that often." Ruby said. Elena looked disappointed at this claim.

"Whaaaat? Is THAT how I have been represented to you, Ruby?" Guthrie jokingly said to her. He knew she was sort of right, and he knew it made Elena annoyed that he didn't pas gas as prominently as she would prefer.

"Sis is right...unfortunately." Elena added.

"Whaaaaat? You too, Elena? I didn't think my cousins saw me that way! I totally see what you mean, Ryan. People getting the wrong idea about you can be a real issue!" Guthrie continued playfully.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121.title: They evacuate the cabin.

choices: A Fartmeister fart contest is sparked.
11233222212221212222222212212222111212.content:
Guthrie turned so he was facing towards everyone else and his back was pointed to a nearby spot into the woods.

"Guthrie, normally I would be totally good with what you are about to do, but Jerms and the others are all-!"

Guthrie cut Ryan off, "Oh don't you worry, Ryan! My backside is pointed away from them all! What I'm about to whip up won't harm them in the slightest! That, however, in no way means they'll be weak ones!"

PPPPPPVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTT!!!!

Guthrie ripped a long and very loud fart, bending the trees in a wide area behind him backward and burning up all of their leaves instantly. The trees, normally huge and thick, were charred and reduced to shriveled stumps from the strength and smell Guthrie caused.

"Ruby? Elena? Wattya think?" Guthrie asked, seeing his cousins giggle. After a moment he put on a fake upset expression. "...Not much, huh? Boy, nothing left to do but to kick it up. Hopefully this big one will make up for that." he said, pretending to sound embarrassed.

BBBBBBBWWWWWWWOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOORRRRRRRRRRRRRBBBBTTTTTT!!!!!

The Fartmeister blasted a very loud, very low-pitched, foghorn-like fart. The ground shook like an earthquake all around him, and the area behind him that had suffered his power vibrated especially violently. In fact, the ground in the blast range soon collapsed in on itself with a loud crash that nearly matched the sound of Guthrie's gas in volume. All that was left was a barren and crumbled area of earth with charred wood pieces embedded in it.

The volume of this event was actually strong enough to jolt Kyle, Scarlett, Jeremy, Holly, and Bianca back to consciousness. They awoke to Elena's and Ryan's laughter, Corey's applause and grin, and Ruby's giggling.

"Whats so dang funny?" Scarlett asked.

Guthrie, still having a somber facade, had his head hung. "They are laughing at...ME. I-I tried to impress my cousins with my ability, but I just can't catch up to them! They'll always see me as someone with no fart game. I don't know what else I can do! And now Ryan and Corey are having fun at my expense!"

"What are you TALKING about?" Holly said in both confusion and annoyance.

"He's messing with his cousins, Holly. You know, the thing you LOVE to do? Or are you seriously oblivious to your own annoying antics?" Bianca told her.

"Bianca, yikes!" Kyle said at her knee-jerk reaction.

"Bianca has a routine she does whenever she wakes up, and when thats thrown off: She. Gets. TESTY." Holly explained, treating it as just a typical occasion.

"Sorry about all that, Bianca. You too, Holly. I was sleeping the other way like you said, but that doesn't stop them from slipping out." Corey said, smiling sheepishly.

"Its fine, Corey, really. I just need to...take a shower and stuff to get myself back on track." Bianca said.

"That is gonna be a problem, because the cabin is quarantined right now. It wasn't just MY gas. Elena, Ruby, and Ryan's gas is also mixed in there, so it could take awhile to...clear up."

"What about Guthrie?"

Guthrie sighed, shaking his head slowly, walked over to his cousins, and used thir shoulders like armrests. Ruby and Elena glanced at him, knowing he was up to something silly.

FFVVBBTT...FFVVBBTT....FFVVBBBTT....FVVBBTTT...FVVBBBTTT....FVVBBBTT...FVVVB BTTT...FVVVVBBBTTT....FFVVVBBTTT...FVVBBBTT...FVVVBBBTTT...

Guthrie started to go on a silly sob-story as he let out a sharp stuttering fart throughout. "I...I didn't pass anything...My cousins told me I'm not one for breaking wind, even though I'm a Fartmeister...All this time I thought I embraced that name, BUT it looks like I thought wrong...I tried to change their opinions of me, and I thought I did good on that...That clearing hasn't always been there, if you know what I mean...They just laughed at me...I let my cousins down, but I hope they realized I tried my best..."

Guthrie ended his ramble (and rumbling) with a quick grin, and Elena and Ruby were snickering throughout all of this.
11233222212221212222222212212222111212.title: Guthrie decides to "prove himself".

choices: The group decides to go hiking.
112332222122212122222222122122221112122.content:
"...So you did all THAT?" Scarlett asked, pointing to the altered area.

"Mmm-hmm!" Guthrie replied with a nod.

"Wow, you could rent yourself out to a demolition crew!"

"Or work as a lumberjack!" Kyle added.

"Kyle! I'm REALLY sorry for what I did back there! I didn't count on it being THAT toxic!" Elena said to him. "...Oh, and you too, Scarlett." she quickly added in a less apologetic tone.

"Oh whatever, Elena." she replied, sticking out her tongue.

"Its alright, Elena." Kyle said.

Ruby knew apologies were in order on her "end" as well. "Jeremy! Listen, I am SO-"

Ryan ran up in front of her and cut her off. "She-she is SO glad you're okay now! That noon thunder I had was pretty lethal! We were worried you were going to be out for DAYS, Jerms! I-I think it had something to do with that sleeping bag! I must've somehow slept on it weird, and it made my noon thunder WORSE or something? Ruby and I thought it would be safer if she and I switched places! It would make things less embarrassing for all of us!...Well, for YOU GUYS. I felt pretty bad for knocking you out like that, but you know I have no shame, Jerms!"

"Yeah, um, its okay, Ryan? Don't worry...about it? All that works for ME?" Jeremy replied, blinking a few times in confusion. He didn't really understand exactly what Ryan was saying, and that wouldn't be the first time that has happened, but he assumed what his friend had to say was valid.

"Whoa, hang on! Whats wrong with my sleeping bag-?"

"Bianca, shush!" Kyle loudly whispered to his sister, cutting her off.

"But-but everyone who has tried them LOVES them! I just wanna know why he didn't-"

Holly was the one to cut her off this time. "Its a cover-up, you dink."

"Ohhhhhhhh!" Bianca didn't know what Ryan was trying to hide from Jeremy, but she assumed it was for the best.

Ruby pulled Ryan to the side and whispered to him. "Ryan, why did you take the fall for me?"

"Because I knew that it would bother you if he knew the truth." he whispered back.

"What?"

"You know, that YOU were the one that KOed him from your all-night emission! Even though I knew that Jeremy wouldn't be upset about it, and I'm sure YOU know that too, I DID know that YOU would be."

"Wow, Ryan, thank you."

"Oh, by the way, Ruby, I wouldn't really call that 'taking the fall', because that implies embarrassment, I would use the term 'taking the credit'!" he added with a wink, which made Ruby smile.

"Everyone is conscious and, once more, explanations were in order. Now that all THAT is taken care of, and since the cabins air is unsafe for breathing, what shall we all do?" Guthrie asked.
112332222122212122222222122122221112122.title: Something else happens.

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content: "Get your gear on! We're goin' hiking!" Guthrie announced in a booming voice. "Don't knock down a mountain" said Holly. "Shut up" said Bianca, giving off a ticked glare. Later... "We're halfway there" exclaimed Guthrie. "Can we rest, I'm getting tired and... Ruby was interrupted by Ryan by him screaming.."MY LEGS! MY LEGS!" "Alright but not for long" Even more later... "Yes! We made it!" "Calm down Elena" warned Ruby playfully. "It's beautiful" said Jeremy. It was silent for a while, the whole gang in awe.A calming silence until BBBBBBBRRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAPPPPPP." RYAN!" "sorry"
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: The group decides to go hiking.

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
"Well that was quite the SPECTACLE!" Guthrie joked as he adjusted his glasses. "But I think its time to head downward, huh?"

"Thats always the hard part..." Ruby lamented.

"Going up was already the hard part. Why would you say hiking was a good idea?" Holly said in an annoyed tone to Guthrie.

"Hey, it was the first thing that came to my mind in a place like this." Guthrie replied, holding up his hands defensively.

"Don't worry about her, Guthrie. Holly is just self-conscious is all." Bianca said.

Holly flinched upon hearing this. "I am NOT self-conscious, Bianca, I just don't like hiking! Mountain biking is something I can get behind, but mountain hiking is not!"

"You wouldn't be able to mountain bike even if you actually wanted to, Holly."

"What are you talking about, Bianca?" Jeremy asked.

"And what do you mean by Holly being self-conscious?" Corey asked.

"She means nothing! Bianca, once again, has no clue what shes talking about!" Holly answered, looking at the ground.

"While its not on the level of Ruby and farting, Holly isn't very...physically strong, so in order to 'fake it 'till you make it', as they say, she tries to give off the impression that she IS." Bianca answered.

"'Not on the level?!'" Ruby exclaimed with a little blush.

"...Is that why she's kind of a...jerk?" Scarlett asked.

"Nah, thats just the way she is!" Bianca said, playfully slapping Holly on the back and trying to lighten her up.

"Holly if you want to get stronger, Jerms and I can train you." Ryan offered.

"Of course you and the bodybuilder could, but I don't want you to." Holly replied.

"I'll bet Holly actually wants it, but her ego is stopping her from letting you help." Scarlett theorized.

"And who the heck are you to judge, kid?"

"I'm just calling it like I see it!"

"Look, even if she does or doesn't want help, this hike will make an incredible workout for all of us." Jeremy said.

They started scaling back down the mountain with Guthrie going down first, Ruby, Jeremy, and Scarlett going down second, Holly, Elena, and Ryan going down third, and Corey, Kyle, and Bianca going down fourth.

As they were climbing down, Elena lost her grip and slid down a little.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Down the mountain...

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
"ELENA!" Ruby exclaimed and Guthrie in horror. Luckily, Elena was able to catch herself and before falling on Scarlett.

"Phew! That was a close one!" Elena said, breathing a sigh of relief.

After a couple of seconds, and with Elena's butt almost having been on her head, Scarlett realized what Elena had done.

"Ugh! Elena! Gross!" she exclaimed, unable to cover her nose from the Fartmeister's SBD due to holding onto the mountain.

"Revenge!" Elena said with a giggle.

"Great reflexes Elena! And great gas too!" Ryan said.

Ruby smiled a little and shook her head. "Leave it to Elena to cap off what could have been a serious injury with a fart." She was glad that her little sister was just fine.

"Urgh! I'm not used to this kind of stuff! I'm not one for having this kind of hobby!" Corey said, straining.

"I feel you, Corey!" Ruby said.

"Come on you two, if Kyle can do it, than so can everyone else! Even Holly!" Bianca said.

"Hey!" Holly and Kyle exclaimed in unison.

"Don't worry gang, we're almost back down." Guthrie said.

At last they finally reached ground-level. Corey and Ruby breathed a sigh of relief and leaned up against the bottom of the mountainside.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Elena saves herself.

choices: Corey and Ruby have a fart contest.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
PPPPPVVVVVVVVVVVVRRRRRRBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBPPPPPPPPPPPPPTTTTTT!!!!!

Corey smiled smugly as he ripped a very loud sharp fart that lowered in pitch as it increased in volume, causing the mountain to rumble from the force (or maybe it was his fart that just SOUNDED like rumbling?), and shake rather violently.

"Ahhhhhhh..." he sighed again.

"Dang Corey, that was a big one." Scarlett said.

"Yeah, maybe its YOU I should've told not to knock down the mountain instead of Guthrie." Holly added, which made Corey grin and blush slightly.

Ruby narrowed her eyes a little. Not wanting to be outdone by her rival, and wanting to display her newfound confidence, she cut one too.

PPPPPPPPBBBBBBBRRRRRRRRRRRRBBBBBBBTTTTTTTTT!!!!...BBBBBBBRRRRRBBBBBTTTTTTTT! !!...BBBBBRRRRRRRRBBBBBTTTTTT!!...BBBBRRRRBBBTTTT!

Ruby lifted her leg a little and blasted a very loud low-pitched fart, which echoed off of the mountains (or maybe that was just the sheer volume and power of her blast?), and even caused large cracks to appear along the lower portion of the mountain.

Elena applauded her sisters emission. "Wow! Nice one sis! I'll bet that could be heard for miles!"
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Corey farts.

choices: One of the sisters does just that.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
"Alright, you know I don't like to be a killjoy, especially when it comes to fart contests, and especially ESPECIALLY if Ruby is proudly participating. However we don't need to cause any avalanches or turn the mountains to dust, right?" Guthrie said.

Elena's eyes lit up at the thought of that. "YES! Of course we do!"

"Yeah, that would be so cool to see." Kyle said.

"It WOULD be very impressive, sure." Jeremy said.

Guthrie giggled a little and adjusted his glasses. "Yes, I know, silly question. I would honestly love to see such a thing myself. However, what I meant by that is we still have a hike to continue on with, right?"

"...I suppose so." Holly grumbled. She was kind of hoping the mountain climb was the last of it.

They all walked onward and reached a large creek that was pretty deep.

"How do we get past THIS thing? Its too deep to walk through." Scarlett said.

"Ruby could blow away all of the water in the creek from the force! Or Elena could make it all evaporate with sheer smell! Its just like the time at the park!" Kyle suggested.

"Kyle, I'd LOVE to do that!" Elena said, blushing.

"I wouldn't mind doing that either, Kyle." Ruby said with a smile.

"You've come a long way Ruby!" Elena said, overjoyed that her sister was finally becoming comfortable and proud of her gas.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Guthrie interrupts

choices: Ruby blasts out the water with her force.
Elena evaporates the water with her smell.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content: Which sister's idea do they try?
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: One of the sisters does just that.

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
"REAAAAAL sorry, but your cousin is going to have to be a killjoy again! Farting our way through this trip sounds like a BLAST, BUT it wouldn't be much of a hike, am I right? I love putting a Fartmeister spin on things, you know I do, but it takes away the...how do I say this? The genuine feel of being out in nature like this?" Guthrie explained.

"...He's got a point." Scarlett said.

"Yep, I can agree with that." Ryan said.

"...Now that I think about it, cutting our way through things with gas DOES sort of take the challenge out of it." Ruby realized.

"...Ugh! Fine!" Elena groaned.

"I don't see the issue with shortcuts." Holly turned towards Corey. "Like I'll bet you could create a new waterway by blowing out a massive ditch that goes for miles, and somehow causing the water to change in that direction because the smell blocks it off from the old waterway or something like that for some reason."

"H-HOLLY! I don't even know if I'm even capable of DOING that! I-I would probably just end up blasting a huge crater and forming a lake!" Corey exclaimed, blushing greatly from Holly's "expectations" of his flatulent feats.

"Well the crater thing would still work, probably. It would make the water level really shallow or something if its massive enough, I guess." Holly offhandedly remarked.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Guthrie interrupts AGAIN.

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
Holly's comment made Corey blush harder, and even made him feel a little lightheaded.

"Holly, stop complimenting him, you're going to make him faint." Bianca plainly stated.

"Well he already made ME faint, so its a fair tra-" Holly was stopped by Bianca slapping her helmet off.

"THAT'S whats happening? I thought Corey was blushing because Holly was putting him on the spot like a jerk, but she was actually doing the opposite?" Scarlett said.

"No, Holly's still a jerk, Corey is just taking her comments as compliments. I don't even think she realizes she's even doing it." Bianca explained.

"Eh, in any case, we gotta find a less smelly way to get across."

"There's a tree-bridge over there that is more than long enough to do just that." Ryan said, pointing to a large tree that had fallen across the creek.

"That's the kind of tree Fartmeisters turn to mulch!" Elena said with a sly grin.

"Not this one Elena, not this one." Ruby said, putting a hand on her sisters shoulder.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Corey is feeling flustered.

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content: Who falls in the creek?
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Someone falls in.

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
One by one they crossed the tree, and it was large enough to do so without much trouble. Jeremy was the last one to cross, and you would think he would have the easiest time of them all, and so did he. Unfortunately, the muscular boy lost his footing and fell into the creek.

Scarlett, Elena, Ryan, and Holly just couldn't help but laugh at this (although one of the four was laughing in a more mean-spirited way).

"JEREMY! Are you okay?!" Ruby exclaimed.

Her boyfriend quickly surfaced. "I'm fine Ruby, I just tripped up that's all. Its actually a good thing this creek is so deep." He swam to the other side and pulled himself up. "I'm glad I wasn't carrying anything in my pockets!"

"You should really watch your step, Jerms!" Ryan joked.

"It was a slip-up Ryan, and I know YOU know what a slip-up is." Jeremy replied, smiling and rolling his eyes. "Anyway, I guess I should find a place away from here so I can ring-out my clothes."

"Strange, most bodybuilders love to show-off shirtle-" Holly was cut off again by Bianca pushing her into the creek. "Fair enough Bianca, I deserved that." she said after surfacing.

"You DID deserve that, but now you BOTH are wet and its going to take LONGER until we can move on." Scarlett said.

"Not necessarily, Scarlett." Guthrie said slyly.

"Why? Did you pack spare outfits or towels or something?"

"Again, not necessarily, Scarlett."

"Then how? Clothes take forever to get dry!"

"Not if you air-dry them!"

"Huh?! But air-drying takes the LONGEST!"

"Again again, not necessarily, Scarlett!"

"Where are you going with this, Guthrie?" Ruby asked curiously.

"Come on Ruby, I know someone as smart as you can see EXACTLY where I am going with this!" Guthrie said with a grin.

"Uhh, are you saying you want to...GAS them dry?" Kyle incredulously asked.

"DING DING DING! Exactamundo!" Guthrie exclaimed, waving his arms up.

Elena and Ryan snickered at this and Ruby blushed.

"Seriously Guthrie?! That sounds disgustingly funny and all, but that CAN'T work!" Scarlett said.

"Oh it can work, Scarlett. I've seen what the Fartmeisters can really do." Kyle told her.

"I concur with Kyle...It doesn't sound enjoyable, but it sounds effective." Jeremy said, feeling a little uneasy.

"No way. That's terrible, I'd rather stay soaked than being farted on. Count me out." Holly stated. She got ready to jump back into the creek, but Bianca held her back.

"No! Count her IN! If it will work, that's perfect! Plus she deserves it, so that's MORE perfect!" the blonde said.

"...I deserved getting pushed in the creek, I don't deserve getting gassed out."

"Oh sure you do!"

"Fine, if there is no escape, I'll put up with it. Better make it quick at least."

"So who...is drying who?" Kyle asked, feeling weird asking that question.

"Ruby! What about you and Jeremy?!" Elena said to her sister.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Jeremy

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
"No way Elena! I'm not going to fart on my boyfriend!" Ruby objected, blushing a little.

"Why? You've done it before." she replied.

"N-not on purpose, Elena!"

"I'll air-dry Jerms. I don't want Ruby or anyone to feel uncomfortable doing that, since it might seem cruel to blast Jerms for no reason. Plus he'll be able to handle my smell the easiest since I've gassed him out so much!" Ryan said.

"I...had the feeling you would be it, Ryan." Jeremy said, still feeling uneasy.

"And Holly?" Guthrie asked.

"I know EXACTLY who!" Bianca giddily exclaimed, and shoved Holly against Corey.

"Why me?" he asked.

"Yeah, why him? His gas will probably just eat up all of the stitching to my clothing for some reason, or turn my outfit white somehow and I hate that color. If not those then I'll bet he'll cause my outfit to shrink or blown to shreds, both of which would not be good for ANYONE." Holly rambled.

"W-WHAT?! Come on Holly! Thats-thats not-!" Corey was blushing once again, and those last few mental pictures were NOT helping!

"Fine, maybe I'm wrong, maybe I'll just be blown clear across the forest and past some giant trees you uprooted and burned to twigs somehow or something." Holly remarked.

"HOLLY! P-please! I-I would make sure you-!"

"THATS why." Bianca stated.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Ruby declines.

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
"Bianca, you hypocrite. You told Holly to stop saying that stuff for the exact reason you want him to air-dry her!" Kyle told her.

"No, that time it was Corey feeling uncomfortable, now I want Holly to feel that way." she replied.

"...But...that is going to make Corey feel uncomfortable anyway."

Bianca finally realized her blunder. "...Hmm, good point little bro. Holly, stop complimenting Corey."

"I'm not, I'm telling you why I don't want him to do this disgusting fart-dry idea." Holly said in a dull tone.

"Okaaaay, then why not Elena?"

"No, I don't need a little kid."

"HEY! Just because I'm younger doesn't mean my farts aren't powerful!" Elena shouted.

"Don't take what she says to heart, Elena." Bianca said to her, then focused back on Holly. "What about Guthrie then?"

"No, I don't need an old man." Holly objected.

"Old man?! I'm only 24!" Guthrie exclaimed.

"Again, she doesn't know what shes talking about, Guthrie." Bianca said to him, then focused back on Holly. "Then what about Ruby? Shes our age."

"Yeah, but she has...body issues or something like that I guess? She wont do it." Holly objected again.

"Darn right I wont do it NOW, jerk." Ruby said, gritting her teeth and blushing a little in humiliation.

"Ruby, grain of salt, remember?" Bianca said to her, then focused back on Holly. "All that is left is Ryan. He's our age AND has a good body."

"Wow, gee thanks Bianca!" Ryan said bashfully.

"...But he's got Jeremy." Holly objected yet again.

Bianca snapped and shoved Holly into Corey again, almost knocking them down. "THAT'S IT! You are being such a pain in the butt on PURPOSE! Corey, take Holly and REALLY gas her out! Loudly and proudly!"

"Umm...Alright?" Corey was not so sure about that, but he grabbed Holly's arm and walked away from the group, the purple helmet-wearer following him with very little objection and very little interest.

"Guess we should clear the way too Jerms." Ryan said, so he and his best friend walked off too.

"...Okay Bianca, remind me HOW are you friends with Holly?!" Scarlett sarcastically exclaimed.

Which of the two duos does it switch to?
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Corey accepts...kinda.

choices: Jeremy brings it up with Ruby.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
Jeremy and Ryan were at a bend in the creek quite a few yards away from the group.

"This should be far enough." Ryan said.

"I don't know Ryan, its kind of impossible to be far away enough from your gas!" Jeremy joked.

"Good one Jerms, now hold out your arms...and hold your breath." Ryan said, turned away from Jeremy, and pointed his butt at him.

"I hope this actually works. I don't need a special intermission to be gassed by Ryan." Jeremy thought to himself exasperatedly.

FFFFFFFFVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVwwwwwwwwwwwwwrrrrrrrrrrVVVVVTTTT!!

Ryan released a long raspberry-like fart that briefly went into a squeaky fart and back into a raspberry-like fart. As usual, a green fog left his butt and it formed itself around Jeremy and stayed around him. Jeremy's eyes were burning and his lips started to tremble from the smell, but he held still and could feel the putrid emission somehow evaporating all of the water on his clothes and skin.

"That should do it!" Ryan said. The instant he gave the 'all clear', Jeremy covered his nose with his hands. The muscular guy was still covered in Ryan's fart gas, which followed his arm movements like he was "wearing" it!

"Ugh! Ryan that smells awful!" he exclaimed.

"You should've heard the one earlier Jerms, THAT was worse!" Ryan said, half-bragging and half-joking.

"Huh? You mean the moment-killer on the mountaintop?"

"No! The one when I woke up! You just didn't hear it because you were already knocked out by R-" Ryan gasped a little and stopped himself before he said too much.

"Knocked out by what?"

"Knocked out by my noonish thunder, remember?! We had to evacuate the cabin because of all of the gas?"

Jeremy was becoming suspicious. "But if your noonish thunder was what knocked me out, why would you tell me I should've heard it? And why would that knock me out before you even let it out?"

Ryan was getting caught up in his lie. "I wasn't talking about THAT one! There was another fart I let out after that!"

Jeremy wasn't buying it. "Ryan, whats the truth?"

After a long moment, Ryan sighed. "Okay, my noonish thunder DIDN'T knock you out. You were already knocked out. And...it wasn't me that dealt it, it was Ruby. She was so nervous being in the same bed as you that she...she released an all-night sleep SBD..."

Jeremy blinked a few times in complete surprise, especially at the length of his girlfriends emission. "Wow, I had no idea that Ruby felt so uncomfortable by that, but on the other hand, that is...rather impressive. Thats at least a 7-hour long fart, right?"

"Yeah, I thought so too Jerms!"

"Why did you take the fall for her?"

"Well like I told Ruby, its more 'taking the credit' than 'taking the fall'!" Ryan said with a grin, but then got serious. "I did that because I knew she would be embarrassed and ashamed of what she did, even though all three of us knew you wouldn't care."
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Ryan and Jeremy

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
"Even with her newfound confidence she still isn't completely over it, huh? Well we can't just expect her to change her feelings instantly just like that. I'll talk to her about it when we get back, I don't want to bring it up now and ruin the rest of the hike for her." Jeremy said.

"That makes sense Jerms." Ryan replied.

"Hopefully your...aroma goes away by then too!" Jeremy said, cringing from his friends smell still surrounding him.



Holly and Corey were at a bend in the creek the opposite direction of where Ryan and Jeremy took.

"I think this is far away enough." Corey said.

"Are you sure? They could probably still smell it from there. If not smell then I'll bet they could definitely HEAR it." Holly said.

Corey blushed a little, but caught himself. "Lets...lets just get this over with Holly. After all, thats what you've been saying, right?"

Holly checked her helmet straps to make sure it was on tight. "...Fine." she said with disgust.

Corey turned away from Holly and smiled a little, not only at the thought of just hitting her point-blank with his gas, but also at what Bianca said to 'REALLY gas her out! Loudly and proudly!'

Boy was it tempting! He certainly didn't have any issues with Holly, it could've been anyone and it wouldn't have really changed how he felt about it.

Does he do it?
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Jeremy decides to wait.

choices: Holly's "compliments" convince Corey to show off.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
Ultimately Corey decided not to.

PPPPPPPWWWWWVVVVVVVVEEEEEEEEEEEBBBBBBBBBBBVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTT!!!!

Corey narrowed his eyes a little and ripped a very loud, long, sharp fart right at Holly. Her grey leather coat and hair waved in the wind, her legs felt wobbly, and she shut her eyes tight and wrinkled her nose to try and shield out the smell. In fact, it wasn't clear if it was the smell or the force that was drying her, but whatever it was, it worked!

Corey turned around and thumped his chest once, flashing Holly a smile. She gave him a very slight smile in return, while somehow retaining a look of disgust. She then reached up to shield her face with her helmet, but to her surprise, it was gone.

"What...what happened to my helmet?! I definitely remember making sure it was on tight! Did it fall in the damn creek?!" she started to panic.

"Uh-oh, Holly, look behind you." Corey pointed across the creek, showing Holly that her helmet had flew off of her head and was hanging high up on a tree on the other side.

"Oh, of course that's where it ends up." she grumbled.

"Holly, I can go get it!" Corey offered.

"Well its your fault it happened, so yeah, of course you are."

Corey already felt guilty as is. "Ease up Holly, I didn't do it on purpose! And its not like its permanently lost or destroyed!"

"Yeah, that's fair, I shouldn't be like that...How are you even going to get it back? There are no branches or anything sticking out to grab on, and you were already sucking at mountain climbing."

"...Thanks for that vote of confidence, Holly." Corey said in a deadpan tone, then switched to a more sly one. "Anyway, I know exactly how to get your helmet, and if you think about it, I'll be you'll know too."

"...Nope, my minds a blank, just like Bianca's."

Corey smirked, both at Holly's jab at Bianca and at her purposely playing ignorant. "Then I'll just have to show you."

He walked over to the edge of the creek, turned away from it, and stuck his butt out towards the tree.

Holly stared at him, still pretending she had no clue what he was about to do.

BBBBBBBLLLLLLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOWWWBBBBBBBBBBBPPPPPPPPPPPPPPTTTTTTTT!!!!

Corey balled up his fists and concentrated, blasting a very deep, rumbling, bubbly fart. Not only did this cause the area across from the three to shake, but it also caused the creek to bubble and steam. This combination caused the tree to creak and crack (or maybe that was just the sound of his fart?) and fall towards them.

"Watch out Holly!" Corey ran towards her and shoved her just in time for both of them to avoid the tree.

As the tree was falling, Holly's helmet was flung off of it and just happened to land on her head. The tree splashed onto the bubbling creek with a loud sizzle (or maybe that was just the sound of Corey's fart again?) and the waters calmed down.

"Thanks Corey." Holly said with a little smile.

"It was my pleasure Holly!" Corey replied, thumping his chest.

"Wow, that tree is stripped of bark and almost black. I dunno if it was always like that, or if your fart had combustible smell or something to char it and burn away its outer-layer. Probably not, since you probably would've burned it up into a small twig, unless you held back since that would've burned up my helmet too. If you did hold back, your gas is still strong enough to...somehow boil the creek for awhile. I could use you as a gas-powered stove, and not in the fuel sense!"
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: No

choices: The group starts heading back to the cabin.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
As Holly babbled on, Corey's face turned more and more red. "H-HOLLY! I appreciate all of your compliments, but come on! I can't handle all of that so well!"

Holly either didn't care or was unaware that she was making Corey flustered, but decided to change the subject. "Lets just go back to the others."

They went back to the rest of the group, and Jeremy and Ryan were arriving at about the same time.

"See? That wasn't so bad, right guys?" Guthrie said.

"Erm, I wouldn't say THAT." Jeremy said uncomfortably, still surrounded by Ryan's stench.

Ruby gasped. "Jeremy!"

"That's hilarious." Scarlett stated.

"And here I thought losing my helmet for a moment was a bad thing." Holly said.

"Th-the smell will wear off soon enough! Now c-come on, we-we still got hiking to do!" Ryan sputtered.
1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.title: Corey feels flustered again.

1123322221222121222222221221222211121221.content:
They continued on and reached what could only be described as a cliff side made of packed dirt, which stretched as far as the eye could see in both directions.

"Mountain climbing is one thing, but how on earth do we climb THIS?" Ruby moaned.

"I don't even think I could climb this. There's nothing to grab hold of." Jeremy stated.

"Soooooooo, we're done here, right?" Holly asked, trying not to sound eager.

"Nice try Holly, but I'll bet we can figure out how to get past this thing." Bianca said.

"What if we stack on top of each other?" Kyle suggested.

"Now THERE'S an idea!" Guthrie said.

"You guys are overthinking this, the answer is obvious." Corey said.

"Care to clue us in then?" Scarlett asked in a dull voice.

"Its farts, right?!" Elena exclaimed.

"Right Elena." Corey replied.

"I thought we weren't going to fart our way through this hike." Scarlett said.

"I know, but I don't see any other options."

"We could try Kyle's idea, duh!"

"I'm not so sure that'll work. Even if the stack is tall enough to reach the top, how is everyone supposed to get up there?"

"Oh! The person on top could knock down a tree tall enough for everyone else to climb!" Elena exclaimed.

"Good thinking Elena, good thinking!" Guthrie said.

"And HOW are we supposed to knock down a TREE?" Holly asked.

"Holly, you should know the answer to that by now." Corey replied.

"Well whose gonna do it?" Bianca asked.

"Not me. Jerms and I need to be at the bottom of the stack to hold you guys up. Plus...I'd think I'd cause the trees to decay instead of fall." Ryan said.

"I think Ruby should do it!" Elena said excitedly.

"What?! No! If anyone, YOU should, Elena! You're smaller!" Ruby retorted.

Which Fartmeister volunteers?

115.content:
Julie wiped her brow of the sweat that had begun to settle on it. Keeping up with Ruby, a lovesick teenager, and Elena, a hyperactive preteen, was hard enough, but add in her hereditary flatulence? It was almost impossible. Papers flew around the house on a constant basis, and things never stood upright for long. “But they’re mine, and I love them,” Julie smiled.

Julie strutted to the closet to put the vacuum away, and as she did so she picked at the red spandex leggings that clung to her large posterior. She didn’t have a fat ass per say, but it was a little bigger then the next woman’s. She wore a black oversized wool sweater as well, and black ballet flats. She had her hair up, and hidden underneath an old ratty Yankees cap to keep it from falling in her face. Julie spent most of her time at home cleaning and taking care of everything a house hold needed to be taken care of, while her loving husband worked to support the family. It was boring monotonous work but she found pleasure in it as she served her family and she loved them a great deal.

“I need to take a shower before the girls get home,” Julie smiled. But a ding from the laundry room stopped that idea from getting very far. “A woman’s work is never done,” Julie giggled.

As she took the laundry from the washing machine Julie felt her stomach gurgle loudly. “Oh something’s reacting badly with something else,” Julie groaned. “And I just cleaned the house,” Julie lamented. But this is how it was since she was little; her farts would constantly disrupt her day-to-day life, making things difficult. Friends were hard to come by, and she was almost out of college before she had sex for the first time.

It was her husband she lost her virginity to. He was the only man, correction; only person who didn’t mind her gas, hell, sometimes he even seemed to love it.

Julie had gathered up the laundry and carried the basket outside, with her knees locked together and her thighs squeezing as tight as she could to hold her fart in. She had made it outside and was bouncing up and down trying to prevent her fart from slipping out for as long as possible. This is what Julie always did; it was her way of trying to gain some control of the uncontrollable. But the Fartmeister legacy prevented this, their flatulence was more a force of nature than a gas problem, and soon enough Julie bent forward and let her big butt cheeks part.

PPPPPPHHHHHHHRRRRTTTTTTTTTBBBBBBBTTTTTT!

The resulting fart ripped the leaves off the tree behind her, and blowing them over the tall fence that separated her yard from the neighbor’s yard. Looking at the bare tree she was thankful it was fall. “Maybe the neighbors will think they just fell on their own,” she mused as she chewed her bottom lip. “I hope that’s the only problem with this fart,” Julie prayed, but then it hit her. The smell.

The smell was horrible and rancid and it seemed to be everywhere. “God, sometimes it’s like the great outdoors isn’t big enough to dilute my farts,” Julie whined feeling defeated. That’s when she heard the neighbor’s voice.

“What is that smell?” a female voice yelled form the other side of the tall fence.
115.title: An Average Day For Julie

11512.content:
The phone rang and Julie picked up. “Hey Julie!” It was Gladys. “When you were outside did you notice how all my trees have no leaves next to yah house?”

Julie held her breath for a second trying to think, which was made all the harder by Gladys’s annoying voice, it was like Lois Griffin’s voice only more nasally. “I can’t say that I did,” Julie replied hoping that would end the conversation.

“Huh, funny that all my leaves would fall and your trees are looking healthy as evah,” Gladys commented confused.

“Maybe it’s that open septic system?”

“Well whatevah it is I hope it doesn’t kill my trees!” Gladys laughed. “Hey. What are ya doin’ now? I got a little coffee made and I’m about to watch my stories, why don’t you come ovah and we’ll make the coffee Irish?”

“Well I have to shower, before the girls get home…” Julie trailed off hoping that Gladys wouldn’t be persistent. Her stomach was rumbling and grumbling nicely by this point.

“Ahh, come on! It’ll be fun! Besides I never see any othah women going in there. I’m beginnin’ to think you don’t got any friends!” And there it was, Gladys’s nosiness in full swing. But it was true, Julie didn’t really have any other friends and this wasn’t the first time Gladys had tried to reach out.

“I’m always encouraging the girls to make friends, time to take my own advice,” Julie thought to herself. “You know what? Give me a half hour to shower and change and I’ll be right there! Thanks Gladys!”

“Don’t mention it dahlin! See you soon!” A half an hour later Gladys heard a loud crack of thunder, followed by the sound of the doorbell. When she opened the door all she saw was Julie standing on her front stoop in a nice yellow sundress waving something away from her big behind. “Where’s the clouds? I thought I heard thundah?” Gladys asked scanning the sky and only seeing sunshine, “Oh! And that septic problem is gettin’ worse!”

“Yeah, it does smell worse,” Julie agreed blushing red. Julie couldn’t help but notice how Gladys’s body was almost that of a supermodel, with a decent heart shaped ass, and a lovely set of D-cup breasts. Her sky blue dress was tight and left little to the imagination, and went well with her black pointed pumps. Julie couldn’t help but laugh how it all contrasted with her thick glasses and tight fire engine red curls, and oversized hawk like nose. “Face of a stereotypical nerd, body of an angel,” Julie giggled to herself. “And I don’t know where the thunder came from. I was just as startled as you.”

“Well come in sweetie,” Gladys said friendly. She grimaced as Julie passed her; the smell surrounding her perky posterior was indeed strong. “Oh sweetie, I hate to tell you, but I think that smell is clinging to yah clothes!”

“Oh is it?” Julie blushed redder. “Hopefully some perfume will help,” she laughed nervously fishing some out of her bag. She sprayed it on her dress, particularly her ass and smiled as if it was all a big joke. Julie then turned around to see…

1151211.content:
“Hi mom? It’s Ruby,” came the voice on the other end of the phone. “I need your help.”

“Oh my God, is everything okay?” a worried Julie asked, her stomach really beginning to churn the flatulence now.

“Yeah, uh, its, um, I had an ‘episode’ and I kind of blew out the back of my pants. And I put a hole in a load bearing wall.”

“Oh dear, was anyone hurt?” Julie inquired. This wasn’t exactly a scenario she hadn’t heard a thousand times before; with Elena there was usually a little pride in the telling.

“No, it was for an old boat house for the rowing team, it was the farthest from school I could get before I went all ‘BLORT!’ ya know? But now I’m stuck under the bleachers without any change of clothes.”

“Why didn’t you bring any,” Julie said getting cross with her daughter. “I’ve told you a million times to bring extras in case our farts get the better of us!”

“I did! They’re in my locker, and I didn’t have time to get them. It was either grab them or destroy the library! I think I made the right choice here! Can you hurry up? I don’t want to miss any more class if I can help it!”

“I’ll be there in 15,” Julie sighed. “Any particular pants?”

“The brown legging we had special ordered, I think I may be a little gassy today, and I’ll need the durability.”

“Got it, see you soon kiddo,” Julie hung up. She knew she had to tell Gladys she was leaving, so she figured she might as well get it over with. Amazingly enough she had fun with these ladies, except when they were talking about the effect of her fart, but still she had fun, and she didn’t have that with other women all that often.

Julie had taken a single step when her stomach growled. “Not again.” She backed up and put her ample posterior against the house. Her husband had it constructed to withstand her and the girl’s flatulence and she knew she would do little damage to it. So she squeezed those butt cheeks up against it and began to let loose. At first it all went fine, until she realized the force of her fart wasn’t threatening the house, but it was forcing her forward, and before she knew it she launched herself across her yard and into Gladys’s bushes. “WHOOOOOOOAAAAA!”

Julie exited the bushes and looked at her house, seeing a spot where the paint had been peeled off in the shape of two large butt cheeks. “I’ll have Elena repaint that when she gets home, for not taking out the trash like she was supposed to.”

Julie returned to Gladys’s front door and went inside. “Gladys, Linda, girls? I have to leave. Ruby needs me to drop something off to her, but I wanted to say I had fun.”

“Julie, dahlin, you’re not gonna drive are yah?” Gladys asked. “You had a lot of whiskey in yah coffee. Is it safe?”

“I should be fine Gladys, but thanks for the concern,” Julie reassured her, her gossip sense beginning to tingle.

“Ahkay, if you say so,” Gladys said passive aggressively. As Julie closed the door on her way out she heard Gladys switch into full on gossip mode disappointing her a little, “Can yah believe she’s gonna drive? I don’t know if I could if I drank that much.”

“Well I have been good all day,” Julie giggled to herself. Both she and the girls had to watch what they ate on a constant basis, too much milk, too much beans, too much cabbage, and BOOM! A fart that ends all farts. For the most part they kept to salads and fresh vegetables, but Julie was feeling adventurous today. “I want a bacon cheeseburger!”

Julie walked through the school back to her car, but stopped in her tracks when she heard a teenage girl talking to her friend, “I just think its weird how the new girl, Rudy, Ruby, whatever, disappeared for like two periods right after that gas leak put a hole in the wall, and then she shows up with new pants!”

“I know!” her friend agreed. “And do you notice, and I really do feel bad saying this, but do you notice how she smells a little like a fart?”

“She does have like a sour smell to her, but c’mon a fart? Do you know how bad her farts would have to be if she actually smelled like them? That would be so gross!”

“I know I feel so bad even saying it, she seems so sweet,’ the second girl said making Julie feel a little heart warmed that Ruby might actually make some friends, but a little concerned too. If they noticed these things, and the faint smell the Fartmeisters all had, they might eventually put two and two together.

“I’ll have to warn Ruby when she gets home,” Julie made a mental note.

Julie left the building and got into her car, and quickly rolled down the windows. It was a Fartmeister precaution in case they ever got a gas attack on the road, they didn’t want to put too much pressure on the windows and make them explode. “Learned that the hard way,” Julie smirked.

She drove to a diner and decided to sit down; after all she didn’t really have to worry until after she ate the burger. Plus it gave her a sense of normalcy she sometimes lacked due to her flatulence. She ordered her burger and a side of fries, and topped it off with a nice frosty milkshake. “The bedroom’s gonna take some punishment tonight!” she laughed, thanking God her husband was away for the next few weeks. More than once he’s been blown out of bed and slid down the far wall in the middle of the night. “But it’ll be worth the gas tonight!”

Julie ate her food with a greedy gusto, reserved for when she deviated form her diet. But it was no more than a few minutes after she was done, that her stomach started churning and bubbling. “I need to get home, and soon!” she told herself. She paid the bill and was in her car before you could blink; sweat pouring down her head as she felt her gas begin to relocate to her ass. “Hold it! Hold it! Hold it! Hold it! Hold it!” she chanted trying to keep it in. She had never has such a quick reaction before. When she got home she squeezed her thighs together and clenched her butt tight, she was almost to the front door when she saw someone waiting for her there.

Elena ran off to play leaving her mother and Ruby behind. She wandered over to the duck pond to see a boy from her class, Kyle, playing with a remote controlled sailboat. She didn’t tell her mother before but when she farted those bullies out the door at school it was because they were picking on Kyle. She didn’t like bullies, and she figured that with God given flatulence like hers; it was her duty to protect the weak with it. “Hey Kyle, right?” Elena greeted the bespectacled little boy.

“Uh hi, Elena?” Kyle said back pushing his glasses back into place.

“Yeah, it’s Elena. What are you doing?”

“I’m trying to get my sailboat back to shore, but the stupid batteries keep dying, so it’s taking forever!”

“You mind if I watch?”

“No,” Kyle said excitedly. He never has any one, never mind a girl, ask to hangout with him. “So how do you like school?”

“It’s fine I guess, I don’t like those bullies who were picking on you,” Elena replied skipping a stone across the pond.

“Nate Hauser and his friends? They’re jerks! They always find some reason to pick on me,” Kyle explained dejectedly.

“Well I heard they ended up blown away or something today,” Elena smirked, proud of herself.

“I heard Mary Beth, that red haired girl who never talks to me, I heard her say that Nate thought he got farted on from the way he smelled. I’d like to shake the hand of the person who could do that!” Kyle said shaking his head.

“You like farts?” Elena asked intrigued.

“I like anyone who can do that to Nate! Farts or no farts!”

Elena giggled at the funny little nerd boy, but stopped when she realized his sailboat wasn’t moving at all anymore. “I think it stuck.”

“Stupid boat! My dad will kill me for just leaving it out there! There’s gotta be someway to get it out of the water.”

Elena looked around and back to the water. The sailboat was close to the shore on their side, and it wouldn’t be hard to walk around to the other side. She looked back at Julie who was engrossed in her book, it wasn’t often she had time to herself. “Kyle can you keep a secret?”

“Yep, I never told anyone that John Fisher wet the bed at my house,” Kyle said dumbly.

Elena laughed, and looked back to Kyle. “Seriously, can you keep a secret?”

“Yeah.”

“Okay, come with me,” Elena told him taking his hand in hers and leading the way. Elena was completely unaware of the loving look Kyle now gave her. He would never tell on her now. When they got into position Elena looked back around and made sure her mother wasn’t paying attention. “Okay, I’m going to show you what happened to Nate Hauser and his buddies and get your sailboat back, but you can’t tell anyone! Got it?”

“Yeah, got it,” he assured her a little confused. 115121112221122221122.content:
“Well Julie Dahling I was, uh, wondering if yuh girl Ruby was seeing someone, maybe?”

Julie let out a sigh of relief, she had been sure that Gladys, busy body that she was, was going to bring up her efforts to cover up her amazing flatulent powers. “Uh no. No she’s not seeing any one. Why?”

“I have the most mahvelous nephew for her, if she’s interested. I brought a picture for her, so she can se what a hunk he is!” Gladys giggled, as she reached into her blouse and pulled a picture from her impressive cleavage. She handed it over to Julie who looked at it with a surprised and stunned look.

The picture was of her nephew at the beach, wearing noting but a skimpy speedo. He was obviously well endowed, and his muscles were large like a hockey or baseball’s players. He was cut and lean and Julie felt a little flushed herself looking at this picture of a flesh and blood David.

Then she let her eyes wander to his face. “He’s definitely your nephew,” Julie smiled sarcastically.

“Ishmael is handsome, I know,” Gladys said proudly. Julie nodded and looked at him again. Large hawk like nose, tight red curls that looked like a tiny thin afro, no chin and large thick glasses, all came together to give Ishmael a very distinctive appearance. “You know Julie, this coffee was delicious,” Gladys complimented her backhandedly while swirling the spoon in the empty cup.

“Would you like another cup?” Julie smiled sardonically.

“Only if you were getting some for yourself,” Gladys handed her the cup, and leaned back into her chair, not waiting for an answer.

Julie got up and walked to the kitchen, shaking her head to herself. Gladys wasn’t exactly the woman she would have chosen to live next door to her, but she was nice enough. Sure she was annoying, but she was the only woman in her neighborhood that greeted the family when they moved in, and the only one who went out of her way to talk with Julie on a consistent basis. It was hard sometimes, but Julie did try to enjoy Gladys’s company.

The two women talked for almost an hour, with Gladys telling stories of how she used to be a body double for some famous actresses who didn’t like to do nude scenes, “But they nevah put my face in front of the camera,” Gladys sighed.

“It’s a mystery,” Julie mock sympathized as she showed Gladys out. “I’ll talk to you tomorrow.”

“Don’t forget to show Ruby that picture,” Gladys called out as she disappeared down the walk.

Julie closed the door, and put her head against it. She smiled a little as her ass began to trumpet like the horn of Gabriel, playing a deep baritone note throughout the house, releasing a smell that would make a skunk envious of its foulness.

“You called mom?” Elena asked from the top of the stairs.

“You know I farted, now get back in your room!” Julie told her sternly, brooking no funny business form her youngest.

“Why would you girls think I…?” Julie asked confused. “You know what? I don’t care! Gladys dropped off a picture of her nephew and wanted to know if you would like to go out with him.”

“Well let me see the picture,” Ruby said bounding down the stairs, and letting out a little toot on the landing, both women impressed with how small and unimpressive it actually was. Ruby took the picture and looked it over. She gasped and covered her mouth with her hand.

1233.content:
Around two weeks had "passed". Ruby was starting to get (slightly) more comfortable around Jeremy, and her sister thought he was pretty cool. He still had no idea of their secret, and Elena decided it was high time to pay their wealthy cousin Guthrie a visit to "let it all out".

"Hey! Ruby! Elena!" Guthrie said at the door, greeting them.

This host was an older teen with brown hair that went to the tip of his neck and a bit of a gut, and he wore black glasses with square frames, a purple shirt, and black pants.

"Guthrie!" the girls said, entering the home.

"Hey, I don't believe we've met." Guthrie said to the male accompanying them, putting a finger on his chin.

"I'm Jeremy." he replied, offering him a handshake, but Guthrie went with a five.

"Ah, so YOU'RE the boy whose been the talk of the town!" he said jokingly as Jeremy joined his place next to Ruby.

"Umm..."

"So what brings you guys to ol' cousin Guthries place?" he asked the girls.

"We-"

Elena cut off her shy older sister; "We wanted you to meet Jeremy!" she said excitedly.

"Yes, you guys have told me a lot about him; especially Ruby!" he singled her out; making her blush slightly and her stomach gurgle a little.

"Come on! Come on! Sit down, everyone!" Guthrie announced, clapping loudly as he led the trio into the main room with 3 cream-colored leather seats and a large flat-screen TV.

"Hey, you're hospitable." Jeremy complimented as the trio sat down.

"Ah! Not you, Elena, keep your toxic tush up, I need to talk to you privately." Guthrie said, gesturing to himself, "And thanks, Jeremy, you seem like a nice dude."

As Guthrie and Elena walked away, Jeremey turned to Ruby and looked at her quizzically.

"Did he just say 'toxic tushie'?" he whispered to her.

Ruby jumped a little and blushed, "No, he didn't!" she said quickly.

"Oh, I must've heard him wrong, then."

Hours later (at least it seemed like hours), Ruby burst into tears and ran off to hide in Guthrie's bathroom, letting out little poots of embarrassment with every step.

"R-Ruby?" Jeremy said quizzically. He knew Ruby couldn't hear him, but he was still not quite sure what just happened. He wasn't even reacting to the smell due to his shock.

"I think we messed up." Elena said.

"Look, I'll talk to Ruby, you explain things to Jeremy." Guthrie said, and ran off.

Elena plopped down on the other side of Jeremy, "I bet you're all confused and weirded out, huh?"

"Y-yes..." Jeremy said solemnly, not wanting to sound rude or anything.

"Okay, so get this: My family has a...hereditary condition...We all have...super farts. We don't know where it originated or anything, but its always...passed, heh, on to the females, the males are rare. I have it, Guthrie has it, my mom has it, and Ruby has it. I'm sure you can figure out...we aren't exactly popular and moved from places A LOT...so we try to keep our farts a secret. We don't want to drive anybody off or have to leave town...I personally like farts and our power, and Guthrie is good with them as well...but not Ruby...Since she doesn't fart very often, it builds up and is released in one big blast when she gets emotional..."

"That...that can't be good for her." Jeremy said, still overwhelmed a bit by all this.

"Its not! Which is why Guthrie and I are trying to get her out of her shell about it...Plus, farts are great and I want her to be loud and proud about it, like I am!" Elena said with confidence, letting out a toot. Her demeanor quickly changed though, "But...at the same time...I see why she feels that way since...we don't have...any-"

Jeremy smiled and stopped her, "You do now. Your families gas is okay with me."

"REALLY?!" Elena exclaimed, lighting up.

Jeremy nodded, "Yep."

"I-I'd hug you for this, but thats Ruby's job since she likes you and all." she said, trying to contain her excitement but unable to contain her secrets.

"Ruby WHAT?"

"Come on, then." Guthrie said, standing up and pulling Ruby up by the arm. "And don't worry, if he DID run out on us, Elena and I will give him the gassing of a lifetime!" he added with a grin, making Ruby giggle a little.
