1233212112221.title: Elena accidently farts at Jeremy.

12332121122212.content:
"Sorry, not today, you guys. Its getting a little late as is." he told them.

"I understand." Ruby replied.

"I'm actually going to head on home." Jeremy said, getting up.

"Alright, well see ya! It was fun hanging out today!" Guthrie said.

"Yeah, same here, Guthrie. Elena and Ruby, see you at school tomorrow." Jeremy waved and headed out the door, but not before giving Ruby a hug.

As they heard his motorcycle speed away, Ruby looked a little down. "I really hope he wasn't mad at us for all that."

"Oh my gosh, you are such a worrywart, sis!" Elena said with annoyance.

"And even if he was, it'll all...BLOW AWAY by tomorrow." Guthrie half-joked, which made Ruby groan, and not because of the fart joke.

The next day at school...
12332121122212.title: Jeremy declines.

123321211222121.content:
Ruby was in English class when her teacher spoke up.

"We have a new student attending this school. Please give a welcome to Ryan."

In front of the class was a boy wearing a short-sleeved black shirt, and slightly-baggy blue pants. His hair went down to about the bottom of his neck with his long bangs combed to the right.

"Hey, all. My names Ryan. I love sports, tacos, and just hanging around my friends." he greeted with a wave.

"Now he needs someone to familiarize him with this school. Ruby, since you've been going here for a little longer than Ryan has, would you mind?"

"Oh, sure, I'll do it." Ruby said, not really expecting to be chosen. Ryan then took a seat next to her.

"So you must be new here too?" he asked her.

"Yeah, my family moved here a few months ago."

"Sooooooooo...How are things around here?"

"Well, so far, so good. This is the first place my family moved to where I really felt at home. We still have our...problem, but we've learned to live with it."

"Whaaaaaaaaat?" Ryan tilted his head in confusion.

Ruby gasped when she realized she was revealing an awful lot to someone she literally just met. "Oh, its nothing...Really, its fine."

"You have a problem with your family...but its FINE?" Ryan was now suspicious, on top of his confusion.

Ruby began to blush in embarrassment, but luckily she was saved by the bell.

"Oh, look at that, there's the bell." she said with false enthusiasm, changing the subject.

"Yeaaaaaah." Ryan knew what she was trying to do, but he wasn't going to push the situation any further for someone he just met.

Next was...
123321211222121.title: with Ruby

1233212112221211.content:
At the cafeteria, Ruby and Ryan got their trays and into the line.

"This is school food, so don't expect it to taste-" Ruby was cut off by Ryan, who gasped in amazement.

"The school is serving TACOS?! On my first day?! Its too good to be true!"

Ruby giggled a little at his strange reaction. "Wow, you REALLY like tacos, huh?"

"Mmm-hmm! Not just because they taste good, either!"

"Well like I was saying, don't get your hopes up with school food."

"Oh I've been there with gross lunches, and its...bad. Yeah, um, so where do you sit?"

"Over there."

After they got their food, Ruby let Ryan to a table in the far corner of the cafeteria.

"Way in the back, huh? And there is someone else there too?" Ryan said, feeling a little bad, and also seeing Elena already there.

"Hey, Ruby and- Um, whose he?" Elena asked as they sat down.

"Names Ryan; I'm new here." he said quickly, then began stuffing his face with tacos.

"I'm...Elena." the young girl said, a little confused and surprised at his behavior.

"He...really likes tacos." Ruby said with a smile.

"He's not the only one! Wonder if its for the same reason as ME!" Elena replied, now amused.
1233212112221211.title: Lunch

choices: Those tacos start to kick in...
Skip to after school by the park.
12332121122212112.content:
Then, Jeremy went to join them, but gasped and dropped his tray in surprise when he saw Ryan.

"Wait a minute...is that you, Ryan?!"

Ryan looked and nearly choked on his food, also in surprise.

"Oh my gosh, JEREMY?!"

Elena and Ruby just glanced at each other.

"I...I don't believe it!" Jeremy exclaimed, sitting down.

"Yep, it really IS you, Jerms! I'd know that top-heavy build anywhere!"

"And I'D know that taco-stuffing face anywhere."

"Geez, it has been a long time!"

"So what brings you here?"

Ryan looked like he was about ready to burst with joy. "I moved here, Jerms!!"

"You're kidding!"

"No! I'm serious!"

"Thats awesome, Ryan!"

"You're telling ME!"

"Um, sorry for interrupting, but how do you two know each other?" Ruby asked.

"Yeah, Jeremy has been here for a long time, and Ryan just got here." Elena added.

"Remember when I said I liked sports, Ruby? Well two years ago, there was this basketball tournament hosted here. Jeremy and I were kind of friendly rivals and both of our teams made it real far. The prob is that the tournament was going to last for the entire week and I lived, like, two hours away. So rather than having to drive ALLLLLL the way there and ALLLLLLL the way back the next day, I figured I'd ask Jerms if I could just crash out at his place. He and his folks wre super nice about it and let me. Heck, they even made tacos one night! That...was, well, it was kind of a double-edged thing for them, but Jerms had to know sooner or later...Anyhoo, we became good pals, but after that, we never got to see each other...UNTIL NOW!" Ryan explained.

"Thats great that you two are reunited now." Ruby said.

"Yeah, but what do you mean by double-edged thing?" Elena asked.

"Thats...um, well, I can...How about we all meet up at like, the mall or something after school today and I'll let you guys in on it. This...town has like, a mall, right?" Ryan said.

"The...mall? How about the park?" Jeremy wasn't sure the mall was the best idea for meeting up.

"Alright, fine. Its all settled then! So now I gotta ask for a little origin story here. Jerms, I'll assume you know these two girls?" Ryan asked.

"Yeah, they are sisters and they moved here a few months ago. They and their cousin are good friends...Well, Ruby is more than...We're actually together." Jeremy said, him and Ruby blushing a little.

"HAHA! So chick-magnet Jeremy finally picks out a girlfriend! Never thought you would, I just figured you liked the attention! I also never figured nerds were your thing, but Ruby is a reaaaaal looker!"

"Oh my gosh, don't say stuff like that, Ryan..." Jeremy muttered, him and Ruby blushing even more.

"Ha! Ryan, you aren't too bad yourself. Don't...YOU get any girls?" Ruby asked.

"Uhhhhhh, nah!" Ryan said, looking away.

"Aww, how come?"

"Because I...gotta get thirds!" Ryan quickly took his tray and stood up.

"Thirds...?" Ruby knew he was hiding something, but didn't push the issue any further. Her other question was answered by Ryan picking up the tacos Jeremy dropped and putting them on his tray.

"...Jeremy, your friends weird and kind of gross." Elena said bluntly.

"Elena!" Ruby scolded.

"I'd rather say he is...energetic." Jeremy stated, although he didn't address the last part.
12332121122212112.title: Jeremy shows up.

choices: Ryan challenges Ruby and Elena to a fart contest.
123321211222121122.content:
After school that day, Ruby, Elena, Jeremy, and Ryan went to the park, and the two males noticed an interesting sight.

Away from most of the public was a gigantic dirt-clod crater. All of the grass in a wide area around it was either missing or dead. The trees around it were missing all of their leaves, and were either burned to a crisp, blown to bits, reduced to what could only be described as mulch, or uprooted completely.

"Whooooooa! Did a meteor crash here?!" Ryan exclaimed.

"I've never seen anything like this." Jeremy said in awe.

Ruby and Elena looked at one another and giggled; they knew it was no meteor, but something just as destructive! Corey really needed to meet those two sometime.

"So what did you bring us out here for, Ryan?" Ruby asked.

"Ah, well, is there somewhere more...uhh, green?" Ryan asked.

The group walked further from the park and reached a clear area of medium-sized trees that were spaced out a little from each other, being planted there a long time ago.

"Perfect!" Ryan exclaimed.

"Well, what is it you wanted?" Elena asked, slightly impatient.

"Alright, girls, get ready for this! I dunno if you two can...stomach it, but if we're all gonna be friends, its better ya know now, cuz you'll find out anyway!"

Ruby and Elena glanced at each other. Did he mean...?

With a smile, Ryan lifted his right leg a little and...

FFFFFFVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVTTTTTTTT!!

Ryan ripped a long fart that came in the form of a faint green smog. The visible fumes spreaded out through the trees behind him, killing all of the leaves, if not burning them off completely, and causing the trees themselves to decay. His gas continued to spread, and although it eventually faded out away from him and sparing the foliage further away, the gas around the group seemed to remain still.

"Wait for it!" Ryan said with a grin.

BBBBBBLLLLLLLLLWWWWWWWWWOOOOOOOOOOOOORRRRRRRRPPPPPPP!

Then, a big, bassy, booming blast of green smog erupted from his butt, sending out a powerful wave of stench that either briefly caught the trees on fire before they exploded into burnt splinters, blowing them into bits of ash, or just tearing them right out of the ground where they crashed with a loud thud that was barely audible over Ryan's thunderous fart. The force of the fart managed to blow most of his previous fumes away, being more strength than smell.

Ryan looked at Jeremy, who was plugging his nose and grinning. He then looked at Ruby and Elena, who were just staring. After a moment, the boy's proud smile faded.

"Ahh man, I REALLY made a bad move, Jerms! I shoulda known better than to share my secret with people I totally JUST met! I just wanted your friends to like me. I...I don't wanna make things super-weird with us all, so I'll just, like, leave." lamented Ryan.

"Wait! Don't go, Ryan!" Elena exclaimed.

"Yeah, we hardly got to know each other." Ruby added.

"So even with what I just did, you...don't...mind it?" Ryan asked.

"Mind it?! Ryan, that was SO AMAZING!" Elena said happily.

"Heh, yeah, you're really good." Ruby said with a smile.

"REALLY?! You guys LIKE my powerful gas?! I...I thought Jeremy was the only one in the whole world who would!" Ryan said, instantly shifting back to his usual demeanor.

"And I thought our family were the only ones in the whole world who could do that." Ruby said, referring to both Ryan and Corey.

"Whoa, HOLLLLLD up a moment! What are you talking about, Ruby?"

"Well, remember in class today when I mentioned my family's...problem we were living with? Well...thats because-"

"Shes talking about THIS!" Elena cut off her sister with a hint of annoyance that Ruby wasn't getting to the point.

PPPPPPPPPLLLLLLLLLLLLBBBBBBBBBBBBEEEEEEEEEBBBBBBBBBBBBTTTTTTT!!

The young girl pointed her butt at a tree behind her and blasted a bubbly fart that blew a huge hole right through the tree and all of the trees behind it. With the lack of support, the tree behind her fell straight back and knocked all of the trees behind it down like dominoes.

Elena looked at Ruby and nodded; the older girl knew she had to demonstrate too.

With a little smile, Ruby pointed her butt at a tree behind her and released an SBD potent enough to cause it and the nearby trees to wilt and decay into mulch-like piles in a near instant, as well as burning up the grass around them.

Ryan was the one who was super surprised now.

"Yeah, so almost everyone in our family has the condition of super-gas. We've had to move lots of times because of it, but I hope this is the last time." Ruby explained.

"Especially since our house here is Fartmeister-proof!" Elena added.

"Well, Ryan, what do you think?" Jeremy asked with a little smile.

Ryan covered his face with his fists and rapidly stomped the ground. He made a noise of excitement that slowly got higher pitched. He finally bursted into pure joy.

"AGGGGGGHH! OH MY GOSH, THATS SO CRAZY AMAZING!! ITS LIKE THIS DAY WAS MADE JUST FOR ME!! TACOS, JERMS, AND NOW YOU TWO!! AND NOT ONLY ARE YOU IMPRESSED BY MY GAS, BUT YOU HAVE GAS YOURSELVES!!"

"Take it down a peg, Ryan. You're going to explode into confetti or something." Jeremy joked.

"Isn't it so cool, Ryan?! I'M excited that YOU'RE excited about all this!" Elena also exclaimed.

"I think we'll be great friends." Ruby said with a smile.

"YES! YES WE WILL, RUBY!" Ryan shouted, pumping his fists in the air.
123321211222121122.title: Skip to after school by the park.

choices: The group gets in Ryan's car and heads off.
1233212112221211222.content:
"Now that we all know...Why did you want us to meet in the mall before, Ryan?" Ruby asked.

"I...I like to break wind in public. Its just entertaining to see what'll happen to everything and how people will react and be affected by it." Ryan admitted.

"Oh I can agree with you on THAT!" Elena said with a grin.

"To tell you the truth, Ryan...Elena and I can't really do that, at least not on purpose or...at full, well, um, power." Ruby explained.

"Yeah, sis is right. If we cause too much property damage, we might have to move." Elena said sadly.

"You would have to LEAVE US?! Oh no, oh no, oh no! If that happened, Jeremy would probably tear me in half! Th-thanks for the other option, Jerms! I would feel SOOOO low if you had to leave because of me being reckless!" Ryan said in a panic.

"Calm down, Ryan. Even if we DID go to the mall, We would warn you about this. I knew you wanted to...show off your...talent, and maybe the girls did too, so thats why the outskirts of the park was perfect." Jeremy calmly told him.

"Yeah, we can still freely pass gas! We just have to be at the right places!" Elena said excitedly.

"For example: By our house, over here, somewhere nobody ever goes to, or at our cousins place." Ruby explained.

"Does that mean your COUSIN has your ability?!" Ryan asked, excited again.

"Yep, but hes more responsible with it, just like our mom is. Neither of them are against blasting gas, but they aren't as wild about it as you, I, or Corey are." Elena told him.

"Corey? Is that-? Um, wait, or...or Ruby, right?"

"Sis is kind of a mixed bag. Around her family or Corey, shes got no issues with it. Around Jeremy, which I'm gonna guess unfortunately goes for you too, since you'd be hanging out with him a lot, she gets self-conscious and shyer than usual." Elena said with a hint of monotone in her voice.

"Elena!" Ruby said through gritted teeth and blushing slightly. Elena just totally layed into her in front of their new friend!

"But she is getting better at it!" Jeremy quickly added in Ruby's defense, also seeing Elena's words as a bit harsh.

"Ah, it makes sense, though! She likes Jerms and doesn't want him to think she is gross or a freak! Well, take it from ME, Ruby: Jeremy has no problemo with ANY of it! I mean, if he did, I don't think he would date you!" Ryan said in understanding, but receiving a light punch in the side from Jeremy for the last part.

"I...I know he doesn't care, and I know he is even impressed by it...but still, its...I guess its more me than him. My cousin and Elena are confident I'll become more...confident about it, and I believe so too. I want to become comfortable with it around you guys, and just in general, but it...takes time is all..." Ruby admitted.

"Well Jerms and I are confident you will too! I'll tell you something about me that'll make you feel better, I bet! Back where I used to live, I also made sure nobody outside my family knew about my gas. It wasn't easy, because I felt like I was lying to myself and I never felt a hundred-percent accepted. Well when I stayed with Jerms, I knew he had to know. Jerms was weirded out and surprised at it, which I totes understood, but he didn't judge me for it! He knew there was more to me than that, and he even said it was an impressive talent! THATS what gave me the super-confidence to be myself! When you hide all who you are, your lying to yourself more than your lying to everybody else! Be proud of who you are, Ruby!" Ryan said to her in a somewhat-serious tone of voice.

"Thanks, Ryan. That DOES make me feel A LOT better." Ruby said with a smile.

"That explains why you weren't completely shocked back at Guthrie's place!" Elena said in realization.

"Does...does that mean if you didn't meet Ryan, you wouldn't...you wouldn't LIKE us?!" Ruby asked fearfully.

"Of course not! Even if I never met Ryan, which I am very glad wasn't the case, I would feel the same way as I did with him. Its just a trait you all have, and it wouldn't be fair if thats the only part of you guys I looked at." Jeremy said, hugging Ruby.

"Yeah, Jeremy ain't the judgmental type of guy!" added Ryan.

"Hey Ryan. When you let Jeremy in on your secret, did you like...blow the roof off his house or peel off all of the wallpaper or something?" Elena asked with a grin, changing the subject to something more light.

Ryan laughed at her question. "No way, Elena! I revealed it to him outside and away from everyone! The only thing that happened was Jerms passed out before he could take it all in! He became resistant to it after some pranks-slash-exposure over the following days! Even after the night of tacos, I managed to unleash my vengeful explosion from a safe distance!"

"I KNEW thats why you liked tacos!"

"Well, thats not the ONLY reason, but its a big reason! Thats why I call that second blast my vengeful explosion! Its the tacos powering me up as a...well, a downside for everyone else as punishment!" Ryan explained enthusiastically.

"That...title doesn't make much sense, Ryan." Ruby said.

"I tried to explain that to him, Ruby, but he just likes the name." Jeremy said, shaking his head with a smile.

"Bah! I don't care. So, um, you guys, now that we know everything and are totally tight, what now?" Ryan asked.

"We could introduce you to our cousin! We were there yesterday, but I bet he'd like to meet you, Ryan." Ruby said.

"Yeah, you two are actually kind of alike." Jeremy added.

"Alright, then its settled! I've got a car, but it can only handle one kind of gas! Its part of the reason I don't go to Taco Bell as much as I'd like to. If you girls need to empty out YOUR gas tanks, let it all out." Ryan warned.
1233212112221211222.title: The groups conversation continues.

choices: Elena is right; Guthrie and Ryan have a fart contest.
12332121122212112222.content:
The group arrived at Guthrie's mansion without incident.

"WHOOOOOOA! You guys didn't say ANYTHING about him being rich!" Ryan exclaimed in amazement.

"Thats because Guthrie doesn't like to draw attention to it. It makes him annoyed when people talk or ask about it. He wants to be known for who he is, not how much cash he has." Ruby whispered to him.

"I gotcha, Ruby." Ryan whispered back.

Elena knocked on the door and Guthrie greeted them.

"Whoa! Back so soon? You guys must really miss your cousin or something!" he joked.

"Um..." Jeremy and Ryan weren't sure if they were being too intrusive.

"Kidding! Kidding! You guys are welcome here anytime! Work hours permitting, of course! Still, come on in!"

As they walked inside, Ryan was tempted to ask where the male Fartmeister worked, but he remembered what Ruby said.

"Whoa, hold up there, stranger! Never seen you in my quarters." Guthrie said jokingly to Ryan, holding up a hand in a 'stop' gesture in front of him.

"I'm-I'm Ryan. I'm Jeremy's longtime friend, and I just moved here."

"Just moved in, huh? Welp I think you'll like it here."

"I already DO! Today has been like, the greatest day EVER for me!" Ryan exclaimed, feeling more welcome.

"Not a surprise, since you must know my cousins well enough for them to introduce you to yours truly. Ah! Where in the heck are my manners? I'm Guthrie Fartmeister."

Guthrie expected Ryan to offer a handshake, but was pleasantly surprised when he also had the mind of greeting people with high-fives.

"Oh I think you and I are off to be fast friends!" Guthrie said to Ryan with a nod.

"Yes! For totally sure!"

"Ah! Again, I'm forgetting my manners today. Guthrie, you're not being the best host here...Have a seat at any of the couches with the others, Ryan!"

Ryan took a spot on the large couch were Ruby and Jeremy were at, with Guthrie and Elena in two of the armchairs.

"So Ryan, you knew Jeremy for a long time, but how did you meet my cousins? Did Jeremy introduce you?" Guthrie asked.

"Um, I gotta make a call, I'll be back." Elena said quickly before briskly walking to the other room.

"Nah, I actually didn't even know Jeremy was here until later! Ruby was the first one I met since both of us were, like, recent arrivals and all. At lunch...which I'm still surprised just happened to serve tacos, I met Elena. THEN Jerms showed up and things only got better from there on!" Ryan said happily.

"Just a little bit ago we were all at the park where...sort of the same thing that happened here with me happened there with them." Jeremy said.

"What...do you mean?" Guthrie asked in confusion, adjusting his glasses.

"Ruby, Elena, and I literally let everything out to each other!" Ryan said, rewording Jeremy's fumbled statement.

"Hold a tic...What do you mean by 'and I'? Do you just happen to be...?" Guthrie leaned in, very curious.

"YES!" Ryan boasted, jumping up to his feet. "What about YOU?"

"Well, I AM a Fartmeister, aren't I?" Guthrie boasted right back, also standing up.

"Are you guys about to do what I think you're about to do?!" Elena said excitedly, running back to the room.
12332121122212112222.title: The group gets in Ryan's car and heads off.

choices: They take Ryan up on that offer he babbled about.
123321211222121122222.content:
There was suddenly a knock on the door.

"AH, theres the door." Guthrie said and went to answer it; it was Corey.

"Hey, I was told to come here by Elena. She said she wanted me to meet someone? Are you um...?" Corey was caught off guard a little; not expecting someone other than Elena or maybe Ruby to answer.

"New faces popping up left and right at my pad today! Come right in, Elena, Ruby, Jeremy, and Ryan are inside!" Guthrie greeted, stepping to the side. Corey was now confused; half of those names he never even heard of, plus this guy who lived here!

Corey sat down on the smaller couch, Elena took the spot next to him, and Guthrie sat back down at one of the armchairs. Ruby, Ryan, and Jeremy were across from them and looked surprised to see Corey.

"Uhh...I thought you wanted to meet just ONE person?" Corey said to Elena.

"I did! Its just Ryan you don't know, right? I guess you maybe haven't seen Guthrie in person yet...? You HAD to have met Jeremy, right?" Elena was also confused now.

"So I guess Guthrie is the one who lives here, right? But which one is Ryan...? And Jeremy...?"

"Hold up! Sis, have you seriously not had Corey meet anyone else?!" Elena exclaimed.

All eyes were now on Ruby, whose face started to turn a bright shade of red and whose stomach started to churn.

"Its me! I'm Ryan!" Ryan said, raising his hand. He didn't know Corey at all, but he did know that Ruby was in one heck of a terrible position now and wanted to stop all the tension. "You're right that Guthrie is the guy who lives here; he greeted you. The fit guy here is Jeremy. Guthrie is Ruby's and Elena's cousin, Jeremy is my long-time friend and Ruby's boyfriend."

"Cousin? Boyfriend? Ruby, should I know these guys already or something?" Corey asked, adding suspicion atop confusion.

"Not me! I just moved here!" Ryan said, coming to both his and Ruby's defense.

"You just moved here and you know everyone else already? I've known Ruby for a few weeks, and this is the first time I've even heard your names!"

Ryan covered his mouth, realizing he just made things worse.

"Ruby are you...ashamed of me?" Corey asked, feeling rather hurt.

"N-no! Of course I'm not, Corey!" Ruby exclaimed.

"Then how come I've never met your other friends?...Even though we are rivals, I still always thought that meant...we were friends too." the normally confident and somewhat-prideful Corey felt awful.

"We ARE, Corey! Its just I'm..." Ruby realized that her whole confidence issue with her gas wasn't just hurting herself, it was hurting other people.

"Rivals in what? Studying?" Guthrie asked.

"I thought that too." Elena said somewhat quietly. She didn't intend for this meeting to turn out like this.

After a moment, Ruby spoke up. "No! In farting." she said with confidence. The others looked at her, either due to her reveal, her sudden shift in attitude, or both.

"You've found a non-Fartmeister you like to compete with?!" Guthrie exclaimed.

"Great job, Ruby!" Jeremy said.

"Then-then that means Corey and I-! And you girls-! And Guthrie-! GAH! I'm gonna use up all the good days I'll ever have in my entire LIFE because of this one!" Ryan exclaimed, wide-eyed.

These reactions lifted Corey's mood a little.

"Corey, lemme ease things up for you." Guthrie began. "Ruby here, well, shes shy around new people, especially if they are boys, and especially ESPECIALLY if they are boys she has an eye out for. This nervousness, well, it really jumpstarts her gas, and just the social stigma of that in her mind just makes things worse. These build off of each other until it blows right out of her! The results aren't exactly in her favor in the eyes of most guys."

Corey scoffed. "You're kidding me, right? So you're saying the reason Ruby hasn't introduced me to any of you is because she's actually self-conscious about her gas?"

"More or less, yeah." Guthrie said with a shrug at Corey's oversimplification.

"Thats crazy! There is no way someone like Ruby has any shame about her blasts! We had a fart contest almost as soon as we met! If we hadn't the mind to leave there, then I bet Ruby would have leveled the school with her gas bomb rather than that abandoned building!" Corey protested.

This explosive reveal of Ruby's explosives caused Jeremy and Guthrie to look at Ruby in awe, and Elena and Ryan to grin hugely, even if the latter of the two was just as uninformed about this as the other two males.

"Not to mention she introduced me to Elena afterward, proudly offered a 3-man rematch, and was grinning and having just as much fun as her sister and I were when we turned a part of the park into an impact site!" Corey added.

Jeremy and Guthrie were in even more shock now, the latter's glasses nearly falling off of his face. Ryan's and Elena's grins just got bigger, the former's eyes looking like they were about to pop right out of his head.

"Is all of this really true, Ruby?" Jeremy asked.

"...Yeah." Ruby said with a sheepish smile.

"Alright, Ruby! Thats VERY awesome and VERY impressive!" Jeremy exclaimed, hugging her. Guthrie jumped up and applauded her, while Ryan grabbed a pillow and let out a muffled scream of joy and excitement into it.

"That Ryan guy is...a little weird, isn't he?" Corey said to Elena, who nodded a little in agreement.

"JERMS! That crater we saw today wasn't made by a meteor! It was made by something WAAAAAAAY better! We should find somewhere else that would make a sweet contesting ground and the 5 of us would turn it into a, like, MASSIVE crater or just totally level it, with YOU as the judge, Jerms!!" Ryan babbled excitedly, shaking Jeremy.

"I like his energy!" Guthrie said to Corey.

Ryan then suddenly shifted gears, remembering how this whole conversation even began, and turned to Corey.

"Corey, I hope you aren't upset with Ruby, Jeremy, me, or anyone else here. Elena told me about how Ruby is like. She even said you were specifically one of the people she don't have issues with breaking wind! I'm guessing it might be ME thats a different story cuz of Jeremy, who makes her shyer than usual. She knows that Jerms likes it and that he doesn't care, so its nothing against you or Jerms. Shes just not fully confident about it yet." Ryan explained with a more serious and understanding tone.

"Whoa, I never would've guessed that from her. I guess theres not really any reason to be mad at anyone."

"Great! All the secrets are out of the way again, and everyone is in a good mood! Whats next?" Guthrie asked the others.
123321211222121122222.title: Someone is at the door.

124.content:
At that moment, a guy named Corey walks in. He had shaggy brown hair and brown eyes glasses, and was wearing a simple grey t-shirt with some baggy jeans.

"Hm?" he thinks shocked "Wow..so I'm not the only one who comes in here" he says, walking to the back to sit beside her.

"Oh!" she said surprised "Wow...umm...didn't expect anyone else to be here so early." she starts.

"I usually come here early to help the librarian in the morning, but it seems like she's not here..maybe she's sick?" he suggests. "That'd suck...no Library Club meeting after school, then.." he sighs.

Ruby's eyes perk up a bit "Wait...they have a Library CLUB at this school?!" she asked a bit excitedly.

"Why, sure! Sounds like you want to join, am I right?"

She nods happily as he chuckles "Well, if she ISN'T sick and just late, would you like to stop by after school and attend the meeting? We're always looking for new members! It's...sorta just me...and..like, four other kids" he sighs. "And, we could use more people passionate about books at our school" he says, giving her a bright smile.

"Wow...hes got a cute smile..and face..." she thinks to herself, blushing slightly "Y-You'd do that?" she asks trying to regain her composure.

"Yep!" he nods "Your choice, though.."
124.title: A nerdy guy walks in

1242.content:
Just then, Ruby's stomach gurgles loudly.

"Oh, no...c'mon..there's a real cutie here!" she thinks and groans.

Corey's face grows a bit concerned "Uh...you okay?" he asks.

"I'm....fi-" she starts before a long, loud pepperoni scented fart blasts into her chair, warming it up immensely as it somehow withstood the blast.

info.brief_description: The everyday lives of a family of women with foul smelling and destructive flatulence.
info.description:
The Fartmeisters have moved around many times due to the problems caused by their powerful farts. So they're in a new town, and they've moved into a house built to withstand their farts, so they can break wind without damaging the surrounding area.This is about their lives.

Julie Fartmeister:(37 years old) a housewife who is sweet, calm and kind. She’s tall, plump, pear shaped, and has a cuddly exterior. Out of the three, she possesses the most control over her flatulence. Though her husband Daniel is almost always away on business, they have a strong bond and neither of them has considered cheating.

Ruby Fartmeister:(15 years old) Easily described as a hot nerd, she is smart, focused and a hard worker. Ruby has bouncing D-Cup breasts and as round bubble butt. But doesn’t like wearing revealing clothes, she prefers to be bundled up rather than showing off. She wears glasses and can usually be found in the library with her nose in a book. She lacks complete control over her flatulence, and can unleash a destructive fart when angry or nervous. She was no experience with boys, and hopes to find a boyfriend.


Elena Fartmeister: (11 years old) The youngest member of the family. A spunky little girl who tends to speak her mind. She isn’t embarrassed or ashamed about her flatulence at all. She thinks it’s funny, and will fart whenever she feels like it. Believe it or not, her favorite phrase is “Cut the cheese”.Most people don’t want to be around her, so she doesn’t have any friends. So after moving, she hopes to find a real friend.


This isn't a sex story, it's more like a humor story. Imagine three women who can fart with enough force to blow holes in brick walls or blow leaves off trees. Or it smells so bad it can peel paint or melt metal. This is all about the everyday lives of these people. If it goes far enough, I might turn this into a real story on fictionpress.
